author: {'steamid': '76561198004918832', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 191, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1712363184}
review:
A cool little game with a great soundtrack. I watched Day[9] play it around the time in launched, years ago; but finally got around to beating it myself too.
It's a tricky, one-shot, boss-rush type game. Except it's also set in a mini open-world. Despite the name, think of it less like Dark Souls, and more like a top down pixel art version of Shadow of the Colossus.
The final boss killed me more times than all the other bosses in the game combined though, so be warned... this is still a pretty hard game. All in all, took me just over 4 hours to beat casually on Steam Deck. But there's also some challenge modes that i may come back to one day.
My only real complaint is the lack of accessibility options. A way to slow down the whole game, as seen in  Celeste, would have been really appreciated on some of the bosses. And a way to enable a little aiming reticle so you can actually see where you're about to shoot. I think either or both of these additions would help a lot more people actually get past past the first few bosses. Because right now, that first gate is a massive player filter, which is a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072770942', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 274, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1712277084}
review:
O estilo do jogo é naquele padrão de dar raiva. Inimigos desafiadores que te matam com 1 golpe. Esteja preparado para morrer muito.
A pixel arte é bem caprichada. O enredo é simples, mas é legal.
Percebe-se muita criatividade em cada boss, você sente que os inimigos são únicos.
Se você se estressa facilmente com jogos ou não está disposto a morrer várias vezes tentando decifrar o jogo, não vale a pena (jogar pesquisando o que fazer vai ser totalmente sem graça). Se não for o seu caso, vale o desafio.

author: {'steamid': '76561199113214065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1699006546}

author: {'steamid': '76561198390032634', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 555, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1712350169}
review:
This game is awesome in so many ways, and very innovative, so I recommend it... but there's one thing you should do before playing.

Count to fifteen. In seconds.

Done? Now count to five.

Great, now count to fifteen one more time.

Fifteen is how many seconds it takes to retry a boss after dying. Sometimes less, sometimes more. Five is how long your average fight will be, until you get to better learn the boss.

If you have the patience to endure this, then definitely give it a go!

review: I enjoyed the first hour of playing. After that it becomes incredibly frustrating, not from the difficulty, but from how long I need to walk from spawn to the boss I'm fighting. So much time wasted on JUST WALKING. I really want to finish this game, but with the amount of time being wasted it becomes impossible. I would love if the devs came back to this game just to fix the spawn system and let you spawn directly outside the door of the boss you're currently fighting. Would make the gameplay much more fun and I would definitely comeback to finish it then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025055042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 60, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1711863213}
review: The first few fights are fun and satisfying. But the further you play, the more the game really wastes your time. It gets really frustrating losing a fight in 3 seconds, spending 10 seconds walking back to the the fight, just to lose again in 3 seconds. I beat the first 8 titans, and by that point I had got tired of walking the same paths over and over again in between attempts. If the game had a quick-retry system, I would gladly change my rating.

review:
键鼠不配玩禁翻滚模式！

倒数第三个Boss给我脑血栓打出来了，花90分钟打完前16个boss，同样花了90分钟，第17个Boss愣是没打死：）放下尊严搜攻略，根本都搜不到对应的键鼠攻略。

真的，吔⑩去⑧。。你搞个鼠标射箭不行吗？偏要给手柄玩家搞优待，搞优待就算了还搞出个键鼠无解Boss来。啥时候我过了这个boss我啥时候改差评。

author: {'steamid': '76561199574958028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 158, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1711252679}
review:
Debo decir que llegué a este juego después de completar al 100% Death's Door. Sabía que no me encontraría con un juego parecido más allá de la vista isométrica; sin embargo, tenía ciertas expectativas porque Death's Door es un verdadero juegazo. Dichas expectativas fueron superadas. 

1) Un verdadero reto. 
2) Combates inteligentes y buenas mecánicas. 
3) Diseños espectaculares. 
4) Soundtrack realmente muy bueno y memorable. 
5) Rejugable.

Y podría decir más cosas. El único punto negativo es lo vacío del overworld, pero se lo dejo pasar debido que eso ayuda mucho a la ambientación que el juego quiere crear, y eso lo hace excelente. A su vez, ojalá tuviera más secretos, ojalá esta expieriencia durara más, pero entiendo que a veces los viajes fantásticos sun fugaces. 
Y es debido a su corta duración que es altamente rejugable y muy probablemente lo juegue de nuevo en difícil para revivir la experiencia en unos meses. Un verdadero desafío para los amantes de los juegos difíciles y juegos pixel. Lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159089689', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1710409996}
review:
玩法很单调，单纯地打一个个boss。
难度有，但是尝试次数多了，形成了肌肉记忆，掌握了节奏也就那么回事。
在反复的死亡复活过程中总结经验，适合那些喜欢打boss，挑战自我（脾气得好）的玩家，我个人感觉是挺无聊的一个游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063151600', 'num_games_owned': 1220, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1709348215}
review:
弓箭面前、众生平等；俯视角旺达与巨像、优秀的BOSS战独游。

清库存时发现的宝藏。只有两个键位的俯视角纯boss战与跑图游戏，概念类似旺达与巨像，在简约的美感中给人带来并不简单的解谜式战斗，优秀的音乐与巧妙的关卡设计给人带来极强的临场感，一击击杀boss后所带来的畅快感也无可比拟。

遗憾的是游戏的叙事泛善可陈，单薄的设定与晦涩的过场并不能给人带来对游戏世界的理解，甚至通关后也很难说这到底是一个怎样的故事。

++++精炼的战斗方式，出色的多解关卡设计
++++相当优秀的音乐
++一击击杀所带来的极强正反馈
-晦涩难懂的世界观
-实际背板后boss的招式较为单一，重复可玩价值并不高

如若不在意成就与通关后硬核模式，短暂的游玩过程将极其畅快且富有挑战
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142611101', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1708480646}

author: {'steamid': '76561198375029180', 'num_games_owned': 1496, 'num_reviews': 919, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1623987889}
review: "Titan Souls" é um jogo de aventura e ação que desafia os jogadores a derrotar chefes colossais em batalhas épicas. Com visuais minimalistas e uma trilha sonora atmosférica, o jogo cria uma atmosfera de mistério e tensão. A mecânica de jogabilidade é simples, porém desafiadora, exigindo habilidade e precisão dos jogadores. A narrativa sutil e as pistas ambientais incentivam a exploração. No entanto, a dificuldade implacável pode frustrar alguns jogadores. Em resumo, "Titan Souls" é uma experiência única e emocionante para aqueles que buscam um desafio intenso e recompensador.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074966095', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1708907845}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040497902', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1708431279}
review:
Difficulty curve all over the place (either kill boss first time or complete RNG crapshoot).
If you die to a boss you have to waste time running back to the boss room, sometimes insultingly through mazes or slowly climbing up walls to get there.
£12.79 for this is absolutely wild.
Not worth playing.

review:
I like it, but I have mixed feelings about it.

It's a great super hard 2D fighter boss rush. I wish the controls didn't include holding down the run button all the time, as I tend to get a hand cramp after an hour or so. Also, the amount of empty space and the long runs back to some bosses feel like a mistake.

Recommend only if you're really into the hard boss rush thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199550540545', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1707987714}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065710582', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1707877012}
review:
Here's the thing about Titan Souls. Is it a good game? Maybe. But it has a lot of fundamental design decisions that don't feed into what these types of games should be. 

In a game where all you do is fight bosses, the way they are designed is critical to the player's enjoyment. Bosses should be random [enough] so that they aren't 100% choreographed, but players should still be able to learn a boss and feel confident enough to beat it again after beating it once. Sadly, there are quite a number of bosses whose design feels at odds with the concept of mastering your simple mechanics, opting instead to feed into random results and empty victories. In a game like this, if I feel that I b.s.'d a win, there's probably something wrong with the design. 

Also, on a sidenote, you can't remap your controls on the keyboard. Play with a keyboard and you will kill yourself. 

That being said, the art, music, and general polish of the game were solid. I wouldn't want to give a thumbs down to an indie game that has a fun concept, but I can't say in earnest that I would want to pick this game up again. Especially with the final boss of the game arguably being my least favorite one (outside of the concept of the boss, which, to be fair, is predictable, but still neat). 

TLDR: Good game, some poor design choices. 

Score: — 5.7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199117335393', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1708430195}
review:
独立游戏的一流作品，全一血boss战的设计充满创新与设计。音乐与美术的配合同样出色。
动作设计优秀，手感丝滑，你和boss都是拔根头发就死，大胆但是十分有趣。每个boss都有独特的机制与场景交互，游戏性上无可挑剔。
剧情不太看得懂，几乎没有。
但是地图确实折磨，大世界指引几乎没有，希望有小地图之类的改变。

author: {'steamid': '76561198118740278', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1707086753}
review: This looked like a great game to play on the deck, and it is. It's a really distilled experience, it focuses on fighting bosses and fighting bosses only. If you like a hard game where you have to try again and again to beat a boss, you will probably enjoy this. Or you would, if it didn't take a really unreasonable amount of time to respawn and get back to the fight. If the whole game is fighting, dying, and trying again, the fact that you spend half the time walking back to the boss takes all the joy out of it for me. Definitely don't buy it at full price, maybe at a big discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422609404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1707694390}
review:
No envejeció bien. Presento mis puntos:

1) Varios jefes tienen una inteligencia de ataques a veces errática, a veces predictiva (leyendo los inputs) y casi siempre reactiva, lo que hace estudiar sus patrones prácticamente inútil.

2) Los combates no representan un desafío, sino más bien una memorización muscular de cuando esquivar y que tanto tensar la cuerda en intervalos de tiempo o seguir tutoriales para ganar [en parte, ya que: a) Algunos jefes reaccionan de determinada manera a un posicionamiento particular del jugador, lo que facilita que expongan su punto débil, y b) Algunos jefes y sus respectivos logros son puro re-intento hasta dar con su tempo o por pura suerte. Ejemplos: COME AT ME BRO, Slimeball, Brain Freeze]

3) En el modo SIN ROLL uno esperaría que te bloqueen el roll, no la habilidad de correr. Perder ambos solo hace que la evasión general sea imposible, y que volver a la localización de los jefes sea un tedio innecesario.

[La siguiente crítica fue realizada luego de pasar el juego, jefe secreto y haber jugado (no completado) las 3 dificultades adicionales (siendo éstas Difícil, Acero y Sin Roll) en un lapso de 8 horas]

author: {'steamid': '76561198218174493', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1707324453}
review:
Let me clarify first that mechanically, there's nothing wrong with the game, audiovisually it's gorgeous and I think it's objectively a good game.

So basically this is a boss rush game, each boss being really more of a puzzle than an actual fight. You can only walk, roll and shoot the one arrow you got, which you always need to call back to you like Thor's hammer, it's kinda rad. The bosses I've fought have all been very well designed and interesting.

The reason I dislike it, is because basically each boss is more of a puzzle than a fight, however, since you never know beforehand what you're up against and you die immediately after one hit, you quickly fall into the loop of dying and having to run to the boss again, while your move speed is slow, rolling all the time to speed up is annoying and the loading times are anything but not annoying unless you'd respawn literally instantly, which you don't.

It's partially skill issue, but partially it's also just annoying to run to the boss and struggle so much until you figure out the pattern and then die some more once again until you finally hit the weak spot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984102912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1707321457}

Boruto cried like a little baby and then Hank from breaking bad came in on his magical talking skateboard and said "Wheely, its time to fight the Evil Emperor Zarbok' and they fought with John Freeman who was Gordon Freeman's brother against the headcrab army and also Zarbok and also Naruto and Sasuke was there but his village was not killed by Itachi in this timeline and they all had babies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035112444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1707041889}
review:
While there is a lot of talent on display here, all of that is ultimately meaningless with the, frankly, absurd amount of waiting the game forces you to do between deaths. It's then coupled with the most unsatisfying ending and true ending I've ever seen, leading to an experience that isn't actually fun 95% of the time you're playing it. 

Thankfully, the talent it put to much better use in his next game, Death's Door. It's clear he learned some lessons from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198865575617', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1690431059}
review:
Love the game's atmosphere and the sort of mystery this little pixelated world has. The OST is great with different types of tracks that range from action themes to nostalgic and melancholic. Also this game is very difficult because of the one hit kill thing, but overall a great game.

Also if anyone is interested there are a couple of videos on YT about the game's story and lore.

review: 普通难度全boos通关，我玩了很多类魂游戏都没见过这么恶心的，运气+反应力+攻略=通关，这你妈正常摸索打运气成分能占70%以上，单凭一个人玩通关就已经超过90%的人。

author: {'steamid': '76561198835662632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2798, 'last_played': 1669439491}
review:
This is one of my favorite games of all time, the fluidity is the best I have seen in a souls like game. I really wish there were more games where you just fought bosses similar to this, puzzle styled with no upgrades throughout the game. 

Insanely re-playable, really fun to try to speed run, honestly a 9/10 game. I want a sequel one day (I know death's door is sort of a sequel, and it is a good game, but it doesn't match titan souls in my opinion. Still good, just not enough like titan souls).

author: {'steamid': '76561198140548177', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1705817881}
review: 好玩！简约（简陋）的画面下隐藏着优秀的设计。游戏只有BOSS战，你和BOSS都是一击即死，每个boss都拥有独特的机制，需要用耐心（死）来观察并找出那转瞬即逝的机会，电光火石之间命中BOSS弱点的感觉真的不要太爽（那一下打击感真的拉满）。适合想要体验紧张刺激的B0SS战，并且有足够耐心、接受用死亡来试错的玩家（感觉会很契合魂5们的喜好呢，并且名字里也带魂哈哈哈哈）

author: {'steamid': '76561198818949325', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1622820142}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989535706', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1705273320}
review:
Titan Souls is stripped down, unique, refreshing, and just a flat out incredible game.  You have a bow and one arrow.  That is your only means of attacking.  You must retrieve the arrow after you shoot it either by running over to it or calling it back.  There are only bosses in Titan Souls, no regular enemies.  Each boss can be killed with one well placed shot!  Well that is a lie, there are a few have two phases, so they require two shots.  Sadly, your character dies from any attack hitting them, as well.  The fights are very difficult.  Almost every boss made me feel like "Oh, there is no way I can beat this one" at the start.  Then after a bunch of tries I'd be like "Oh wait, I think I may have figured this out".   Then finally with victory an audible exclamation of victory and excitement.  Beating a boss in Titan Souls feels incredible, truly a rewarding experience.  Titan Souls has gorgeous mostly 2d pixel graphics (a few of the bosses are actual polygons), I LOVE the design of the main character and their little bow.  Excellent sound work as well.  There is something so pure about Titan souls, I enjoyed my time with it tremendously.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198998687764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1705245065}
review:
boss可以说很简单，开局秒boss是可行的。
但是跑图很蠢，非常蠢，一共就那么几个怪，地图做这么大而且很单调。
boss是有弱点的，而这个弱点需要寻找，找不到就会死。
但是，问题就在这里，你要找弱点就需要反复去打boss，而找boss是需要跑图的，并且跑图是极其墨迹和繁琐的。
总不能去寻找攻略查弱点吧？这游戏就那点东西，查了攻略还有什么可玩性了。（5分钟boss rush，25分钟在跑图？免费玩家可以考虑。）
顺便我是花钱买的，我是蠢逼。

review: 死了266次，通关了，这个游戏总的来说难度挺大的，boss没有血条，需要靠自己找弱点来打，进最终地图时弹出来一个成就，只有5.2%的人获得，也就是说这个游戏通关率可能连4%都没有。电骑士、激光双拳还有soul是最难的，最终boss反而简单。

author: {'steamid': '76561199061810290', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1706982390}
review:
Esse Jogo é de estilo Hardcore.

Serio, é um jogo de pegar a oportunidade ou se não vc morre. é um jogo antigo, por isso em promoções é bem barato. Recomendo usar um controle, se não vc vai sofre mais doq deveria, como eu sofri. 

Esse Jogo tem uma vibe tão unica, do estilo de solidão, com um estilo unico q nunca vi, q claramente tem inspiração com shadow of the colossous (tem uma conquista com esse nome) È um jogo Boss Rush, q se vc for experiente você zera em menos de 20 min. se Platinar, vc vai ter algumas horas de jogo (eu estou platinando) Vale muito a pena, é um jogo de 1hit vc morre, e 1 hit vc mata (alguns por etapas)

Vale muito a pena comprar esse jogo. Mas ele não tem mapa, e nem cavalo, ou teleports, apenas chekpoints nas regiões, uma historia meio inigmatica. Gostei muito e recomendo.

Jogo 10/10 Pois cumpre muito bem a sua proposta de ser hardcore, passar emoções e ser leve, e de facil entendimento.

review:
i beat it in around 3 hour but i didnt do any optional bosses/content because it's just not very fun. Retrying bosses shouldnt take more than 3s in a game like this, however most boss runs take like 10s+. The last 2 bosses were manageable because its fast to retry. 
The gameplay is quite fun except for the fact that u have to aim pretty precisely sometimes, it's no fun doing that even with controller joystick (u cant use mouse). also it feels like i just needed to be lucky for some bosses tbh, not very satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207649600', 'num_games_owned': 1989, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1704976310}
review: Хоть игру и рекомендую, но точно не всем. Я сам решил отложить её в сторону после двух часов игры. Всё дело в том, что суть игры - убийство боссов. Причём умирают они от одного попадания как и главный герой. При этом часть игры уходит на одинокие блуждания по карте в поисках локации с боссом, а потом ещё большая часть на анализ босса и попытки его убить. Определенно зайдёт не всем, но есть в игре что-то самобытное. Отдельное спасибо композитору, саундтрек здесь знатный.

author: {'steamid': '76561199388816106', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1703926645}
review: 挺难的游戏，打了4个小时才通关

author: {'steamid': '76561199052122375', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1704544514}
review:
Jogo para testar sua capacidade, ele aparenta ser simples porém é um pouco difícil as batalhas contra os chefes gira em torno de o jogador ter apenas uma flecha e devem recuperá-la após atirar ou chamá-la de volta para derrotar os titãs. Cada titã possui um padrão e uma fraqueza únicos, exigindo observação e precisão.

Titan souls tem uma abordagem minimalista na contação de histórias. A jornada do jogador é aberta à interpretação, com diálogo e exposição mínimos. A narrativa se desenrola por meio de detalhes ambientais e dos encontros com os titãs, deixando espaço para os jogadores construírem suas próprias interpretações.

A arte de Titan souls é linda. O jogo apresenta um estilo de arte em pixel que contribui para sua estética retrô. Sua trilha sonora ambiente aprimora o clima geral e a tensão.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198978001469', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1704197924}
review:
[h1] 为了难而难 [/h1]
首先声明（护甲）：虽然我不满意游戏的设计，但基于美术、音乐的优秀，还是认为这个游戏可以获得至少及格以上的分数。但鉴于该游戏好评中充斥大量新手关可能都没过去的游戏时长，以及剩余大量仅基础模式通关的时长（对后者没有意见，仅提醒成就党），可以看出大量好评系跟风打出。特别好评或许名不副实，仅以差评提醒因高评分不明所以的玩家、普通（一定程度手残）成就党，以及键鼠玩家（说明见下）。

1.适配差，该游戏适合手柄（有全向遥杆）玩家，而不适合键鼠（其实只有键盘操作）。游戏中敌人受伤判定范围小、角度不好找，而键盘只有八向（某些便宜手柄也是。我的就是，服了，玩着太折磨），难以瞄准，平添很多无意义的难度。面对大量键鼠玩家的Steam，制作方没做相应适配，也没有任何提醒。（借用评论区所说，假如能鼠标瞄准，游戏难度会低很多）

2.机制碾压，设计无能，玩家同敌人的机制差距堪比魂一不死人和剑圣一心[list]
    [*]离谱的BOSS。速度快、范围广，各有特殊技能，受伤判定范围小，而游戏表面是双方都即死，实际大多BOSS都相当于有护盾，只有玩家一碰就死。
    [*]残废的主角。跑路慢、翻滚没无敌、只有一支箭还需要蓄力！箭要回收、回收也TM需要蓄力！在此基础上即死。很多时候好不容易抓住极短的机会，但箭射不出去或射不到。就好比电影快放完了插广告，窜稀到一半突然便秘，快高潮了让你先做高数题！
    [*]其它机制。玩家是2.5D的，只能平面移动攻击，而BOSS是3D的，跳起来打不着。这些都算了，我就想问一个3D的球凭什么能压死躲墙角的玩家？制作者的立体几何是体育老师教的？
[/list]
我从不反对敌人性能高，也不反对主角性能废，但两者不能同时存在。黑魂主角性能差，但BOSS性能也不会比主角强太多，或者玩家有强效的针对手段；只狼敌人性能高，但主角也是同一套机制；蔚蓝地图难度高，但主角很灵活而且后期还会加强；优秀的平面类恶魔城或类魂主角机制也都不太差，或着能不断提升。但如该作，敌人强的离谱，主角废的如一，我想只能说明设计者的无能，只能用性能差距来强行增加难度。这种不叫困难，叫刁难更合适。

3.成就设置差，成就党坐大牢。这也是不推荐成就党玩的原因，初次正常模式通关大概只能解锁五六个成就，其它的特殊方式击杀类的尚且还好（也不是没问题，万一没正确击杀只能手动SL大法或等下周目），而剩下的一些成就就属于为了折磨而折磨了，禁跑步翻滚、一命通关、新游戏+（BOSS性能大提升，oh yeah TMD）······有几个成就几乎是正常操作没法完成的，只能参考网上大佬的固定站位速杀，或者开挂（网上找不到挂哦）（给游戏减速有一定的助力），再或者直接刷成就吧，别用十几二十几小时折磨自己。这算挑战吗，有打成就的乐趣吗？制作者你自己喜欢玩自己的游戏吗？可能不是故意恶心玩家就是有受虐癖。
[hr][/hr]
客观评价，这个游戏的美术和音乐都很不错，战斗演出也很华丽。可游戏设计着实让人难受，这方面不改，游戏的可玩性和乐趣就不会太高。我只是觉得特别好评过誉了，但也不是说这个游戏一无是处。至少一周目（3-5小时左右）的乐趣还是有的。玩不下去的玩家也别折磨自己（也别随便跟风好评行不），这不是你的问题。

author: {'steamid': '76561198318911855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1705268877}
review:
Really Good Game Overall 4.5/5. My only issue is the legendary knight and the yeti.

I don't particularly appreciate that the yeti can not be killed through a back shot, it is not intuitive to me, especially after being rewarded for that very thing with an achievement against the cube eyeball on my first try.

My issue with the knight is that the time to strike it should be 10-15% longer because, while I had the skill, my hardware wasn't responsive enough for the timing. I have a cheaper controller, but it is more than adequate for every other boss, even the "secret" last one.

review: С огромным удовольствием провел три своих вечера в игрушке. Хардкорная, но очень продуманная в плане геймдизайна. Нет такого, что тебе нужно бежать пол карты со спавнпойнта до босса, как в творении бабадзаки. Атмосфера в игре просто отпад. Особенно музыка, меняющаяся в зависимости от твоего местоположения. Взял на раздаче, но не пожалел бы и денег за такую игру заплатить. После обычного режима пойду проходить на сложном.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055091370', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1704202197}
review:
Moim zdaniem, jeżeli decydujesz się jako studio na stworzenie pikselowej, niewielkiej gry zręcznościowej obsługującej jedynie dwa klawisze funkcyjne, to potrzebujesz naprawdę genialnego gameplayu; w innym razie wszystkie pozostałe elementy zwyczajnie nie będą w stanie udźwignąć ciężaru, z jakim wiąże się zainteresowanie gracza oferowanym modelem rozgrywki. Zaznaczę więc od razu, że ja tutaj żadnego geniuszu nie widzę, choć niejako rozumiem dlaczego taka forma zabawy może się komuś podobać, co jest w niej wciągającego oraz które jej składowe wpływają na atrakcyjność podobnych tytułów. Warto jednak postawić tutaj kluczowe pytanie: “czy puste ubijanie bossów, możliwe do ukończenia w mniej niż dwie godziny jest czymś, na co skłonni jesteśmy wydać swoje pieniądze?”.

Osobiście uważam, że odpowiedź powinna być negatywna, po raz kolejny pozwalając sobie na ominięcie konwenansów i przejście do sedna. Zdaję sobie sprawę o co w tym wszystkim chodzi - wyzwania stawiane przed nami przy każdej próbie podjęcia rywalizacji, nieoczywisty system walki zmuszający wykorzystywanie otoczenia, wysoki poziom trudności prowadzący do regularnego umierania bohatera czy chociażby “hard mode” odblokowywany po ukończeniu głównego wątku, który ma za zadanie przetyrać nas jeszcze bardziej… słowem: istny raj dla wszelkich tryhardów, speedrunnerów czy całej gamy zawodników wychwalających elitaryzację, opartą na możliwości popełnienia maksymalnie jednego błędu. Czy taka forma wzbudza emocje oraz podnosi poziom adrenaliny? Jak najbardziej. A czy w tym przypadku robi to we właściwy sposób?

Oceńcie sami: przejmujemy rolę nieopisanej, pozbawionej historii postaci, będącej w stanie jedynie biegać, turlać się, wypuszczać strzałę z łuku oraz przyciągać ją do siebie. Lokacje które odwiedzamy, to pokaźnej wielkości obszary, na których przeważnie nie możemy podjąć najmniejszej interakcji z otoczeniem, a jedyną formą progresu są sporadyczne pola autozapisu, do których wracamy po otrzymaniu ciosu w walce z ostatnim podejmowanym tytanem; jeśli zginiemy, zostajemy wycofani do wspomnianej kapliczki i ponownie musimy pobiec do jamy potwora licząc, że tym razem to nam uda nam się zadać śmiertelny cios. A jeśli wygramy? Idziemy walczyć z kolejnym, mijając po drodze mnóstwo nudnych pól, lasów, łąk i zabudowań, tak nieistotnych jak to tylko możliwe.

Ktoś mógłby pomyśleć, że przemawia przeze mnie frustracja czy niechęć do sprawdzenia swoich umiejętności - nic bardziej mylnego, bowiem grę ukończyłem bez większych problemów przy pojedynczej sesji, a poza paroma wyjątkami, raczej nie nazwałbym rzucanych pod nóg kłód szczególnie uciążliwymi. I choć mógłbym oczywiście podjąć rękawicę, próbując swoich sił dalej w nowym, utrudnionym trybie, gdzie każdy oponent atakuje szybciej, agresywniej i niebezpieczniej, to zwyczajnie nie chcę sobie tego robić, ze względu na powtarzalność, która jedynie potęgowałaby moją wściekłość wywołaną ciągłymi porażkami. Bo choć walka rzeczywiście nie należy do najprostszych, to przy tak mizernym wachlarzu zagrań nie ma innej możliwości, niż po prostu rzucać się w wir przewrotów, czekając na dogodny moment ataku, a nie jest to coś, co chciałbym przeżyć po raz kolejny; oczywiście przyznaję, chwila w której precyzyjnie poślemy nasz pocisk wykańczając ogromnego rywala jest niezwykle satysfakcjonująca, ale na dłuższą metę to po prostu kilka przyjemnych momentów wśród gamy monotonii i schematyczności.

Oprawa również nie wydaje się za bardzo pomagać - patrzy się na to co prawda całkiem przyjemnie, lecz ponownie: co nam po takich widokach, skoro nie dano nam możliwości odkrywania tego uniwersum poprzez jakiekolwiek dialogi, przedmioty czy znajdźki? Samej eksploracji na szkodę działa również pewna toporność sterowania, które potrafi wywinąć figla przy wykonywaniu przewrotu albo zablokować nasz grot w jakiejś ścianie, co przez dwuwymiarowość świata uniemożliwia nam jej przyciągnięcie, a to potrafi strasznie frustrować. Zatem pomimo tego, że mamy do czynienia z całkiem kreatywnym, klimatycznym pixelartem pełnym ruchu oraz błyskotliwych tekstur, to trudno powiedzieć, aby współgrało to jakkolwiek z niewielkim wachlarzem narzędzi którymi dysponujemy

Podsumowując, troszkę nijakie doznanie, skierowane w stronę bardzo specyficznej grupy docelowej, a że zdecydowanie do niej nie należę, to trudno mi bronić ograniczeń, jakie towarzyszyły mi od samego początku. Pomimo ciekawych wstawek z japonistyki, dużej dynamiki bitew czy uniesień spowodowanych wykonaniem pojedynczego, śmiertelnego ciosu, wydaje mi się, że trochę zmarnowano tu potencjał; a jeśli proszę o zbyt wiele, oczekując umieszczenia w produkcji fabuły, cutscenek, możliwości wyboru klasy albo chociażby dostosowania wyglądu bohatera, to może rzeczywiście mam zły pogląd na standardy w indie gamingu. Króciutki symulator biegania z bezmyślnie rozłożonymi checkpointami to zwyczajnie za mało, abym mógł być usatysfakcjonowany, i choć zdecydowanie jest to tytuł godny polecenia masochistom oraz fanom ekstremalnych zręcznościówek, to mimo wszystko sugeruję zainteresować się innymi, bardziej rozbudowanymi soulsami.

review: Я расстроен... Не потому что игра плохая, а потому что управление - говно. ладно, передвижение на стрелочках, но рывок на X и стрельба на C ? На консолях - ок, с геймпадом -тоже, но на клаве играть простоневозможно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294926277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1704170406}
review: Não me leve a mal, esse jogo não é ruim, pelo contrário, em diversos aspectos esse jogo, apesar de curto, é muito bem feito. Entretanto, e essa é uma visão pessoal, senti que o jogo tem mira muito inconsistente no controle, - e nem irei falar sobre teclado e mouse - pequenas inconveniências que ao longo do tempo me irritam demais, como o fato de que toda vez que você morre tem que fazer o caminho todo de novo até o boss (às vezes é um caminho relativamente curto, mas tendo que refazer uma boss fight diversas vezes irrita demais), a flecha ficar presa em pixels aleatórios que tornam a luta basicamente perdida e alguns ataques de bosses que, dependendo do RNG são basicamente morte certa. É um jogo bem feito, bem melhor que muitos que eu joguei, ainda assim, não é pra mim e por isso não recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198969734754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1671029574}
review:
Essa bagaça é bem desafiador. Em resumo você consegue matar os titans com 1 hit se você achar o ponto fraco e acertar, porém, eles também te matam com hit kill se te acertarem, e com isso se da a jornada no jogo. O jogo possuí uma historia boa, ela reside principalmente nos bosses que enfrentamos e também no ambiente a nossa volta, como pinturas nas paredes, o local que o boss reside, dentre outras. Com uma soundtrack que meus amigos é muito boa.

Dito isso é um jogo nota 10 a platina é bem difícil (eu que jogo casual só consegui 22/27) mas acho q se dedicando muito dá pra pegar
(Obs: Sim já ficou de graça na steam um dia pra competir com a epic, não acho q vá ficar de graça dnv, me contentaria em pegar em promo mesmo)

review:
El juego es explicitamente dificil en vano. No solo tiene combinada la misma tecla para esquivar y correr (a proposito para añadirle dificultad), sino que te hace lanzar las flechas MILIMETRICAMENTE para dar en el blanco. Ni con joystick. Podes estar venciendo todo el algoritmo del titan perfectamente bien, que si se erraste 2 milimetros a la direccion, es suficiente para haber fallado.
Hecho para sufrir

author: {'steamid': '76561198093589739', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1703627653}
review:
Uma mistura de Shadow of the Colossus + Dark Souls pixelado.

Mais difícil do que parece, tanto você quanto os inimigos morrem com 1 hit.
Eu gosto de desafios, mas nesse jogo apesar de ir jogando, aperfeiçoando, decorando padrões de ataques dos boss e testando abordagens diferentes até achar uma que funcione, eu não senti aquela satisfação de vencer um desafio, com nenhum dos inimigos.
Morri umas 200x até zerar, e a dificuldade em si não é frustrante, é um difícil bacana. Mas algumas coisas me incomodaram um pouco.

O rolamento do personagem é meio quadradão e não tão preciso no timing, não é fluído.
Os checkpoints são desnecessariamente longe da sala do boss, isso sim é frustrante, ter que repetir o caminho toooda vez que morre.

Num geral, não é um jogo ruim. EU particularmente não gostei muito, mas reconheço que é bastante por opinião minha mesmo, outras pessoas podem sim gostar mais dele, então vale a pena experimentar.

review:
Игра в Titan Souls выглядит примерно так:

1. ААААААААААА ГДЕ МОЯ СТРЕЛА??? 
2.ПОЧЕМУ БОСС ТАКОЙ БЫСТРЫЙ??? 
3.ДА НУ БОЖЕ КАК ЕГО УБИТЬ???
4.ПОЧЕМУ ЧЕКПОИНТЫ РАСПОЛОЖЕНЫ ТАК ДАЛЕКО ОТ БОССОВ???
5.Зайти посмотреть как убить этого босса в интернетике
6.ОАОАООА ОН СДОХ!!!
7.боже какой же это был лёгкий босс, хоть закрытыми глазами мог его убить

Повторить этот список действий с ещё 18 боссами

review:
This is just a perfect little game. It vibes like Shadow of the Colossus while playing about 100x faster.
The gimmick is that every boss dies in one hit, but landing it is an ever trickier puzzle the farther into the game you get.
It's short, but it's a hell of a saturday evening.

review:
Pros:
- Great soundtrack, completely fits the world and the mood of the situations
- Gorgeous pixel arts, the world was a real pleasure to see
- Simple gameplay: You litterally need only 6 buttons (and 4 are to move/look), you cannot design a game with more simple gameplay: Aim, shoot, recall and move, that's it, and it fits the simplicity of the game
- Bosses-as-puzzles (some didn't like this part, I did), each boss has it's own mechanic on how it attacks and how it becomes vulnerable/killed, forcing you to first study the boss, then trying different strategies to beat it, great execution in almost all of them, most of the times I died in early, middle and some late game bosses felt my fault rather than unfairness (other late game bosses didn't feel like puzzles, I talk about this in the Cons section)
- Diverse world: Ice zone, fire zone, forest, etc, and most bosses fitted their theme, giving the world a sense of cohesion
- Pieces of lore: They show a "Legenday TItan Slayer" (presumably killed but we don't know when, how or by who), the Elder Titan, the only Titan that doesn't fight, drawings at some walls, etc. I like these litttle hints of what the obscure lore of this game could be, it makes the world feel less empty, it feels like it's trying to tell you something, and it opens up a lot of possibilities to expand later on

Cons:
- Big world, but empty, it lacked... something to interact with, the only thing I can think you can interact with are the doors of the first bosses and... that's it, the rest of the world has some puzzles here and there (torches in the ice zone, that you have to lit to uncover the underwater snake, forgot his name), but nothing else
- Respawn time: Other reviews have already covered this, so I'm just going to mention it because the time you lose piles up really quick when you get stuck
- Lack of support for keyboard/mouse: Yes, I played on keyboard/mouse, despite of the game STRONGLY advising you to play on controller, I don't have one, so I had to play with what I got. The controls felt clunky and more than once trying to run I rolled and died, a LOT, and with aiming it's the same, aiming diagonally was a pain
- The late game bosses... as I mentioned earlier, the early, middle and some late bosses felt fair, they had a gimmick, you had to discover it and strategize around it, sometimes it was easier, sometimes harder, all good. But the last 3 bosses... I'm talking about (spoilers if you didn't complete the final bosses, you have been warned): [spoiler]Gol-Set[/spoiler], [spoiler]Soul[/spoiler] and [spoiler]Truth[/spoiler]

  [spoiler]+ Gol-Set has his gimmick of "you have to press the buttons", cool, but the window to hit the weak spot was close to nothing, the timing was really tight and you couldn't manipullate the hands to move one of them while keeping the other on a button, this forced me to reset a lot of times, because of this "randomness", so with all of this, there wasn't much strategy that could be applied there, it required skill, yes, but mostly luck[/spoiler]
  [spoiler]+ The Soul: This boss conceptually is a cool twist, the "who is The Soul? You? A past adventurer? You will never know", but badly executed because this boss has no pattern, no gimmick, it's just "predict SOMEHOW where it's going to teleport and shoot at the correct place at the correct time", no strategy, nothing, I think this boss is badly/lazily designed because either you cheese it with some random strats, you shoot and kill it because it decides to dodge INTO the arrow, or it kills you because you get hit but some random thing. Cool design, poor execution[/spoiler]
  [spoiler]+ Truth... this boss is more or less like The Soul in terms of cool design (what is this boss? Is it the embodyment of truth? Is it a biblical angel trying to tell something to the adventurer? So many questions, and it's design is sick cool), but the execution is MUCH WORSE, it has given me NIGHTMARES, I had to look for how to beat this boss because the first phase was unbeatable without going to the north wall, and how does the game tell you that you have to do that? It doesn't, you either look it up, or you will spend hours and hours and eventually, with sheer luck, you will guess what you have to do... in the first phase. The second phase is where the real nightmare begins, enemies upon enemies upon more enemies, and you have to kill them all PERFECTLY, if you miss even 1, they start to stack and eventually, they will kill you through numbers. And if you thought that phase 2 was hard, phase 3 is insanity material, seriously, it's like phase 2, but now you have to hit a small target that only opens up when it attacks you, ON TOP of the rest of enemies that can block your shots, and the fact that normally, you will have so many enemies at once that if you miss the shot, you die. And did I mention that if you die you have to start FROM PHASE 1??? Seriously, this was crushing, when you know how to kill phase 1, you can kill it in 5 seconds, but after that, phase 2 and SPECIALLY 3, are frustrating to the point where I had clear that after beating this boss, I was going to uninstall the game, it was not fun anymore, it was like this: "phase 1 then phase 2, death", "phase 1, phase 2, death", "phase 1, phase 2, phase 3 death", over and over, if they limited the amount of enemies that can be on screen that would be nice, but they just stack and stack infinitelly, it's a race of "kill the boss before it summons an army and they kill you" (which, by the way, no other boss in the game does, NOT A SINGLE ONE). This boss felt lazy or unfinished, mostly from the wall trick of phase 1 (who sees that and says "yes, this looks fair or intuitive"? NO ONE), but also the "I'm going to create an army to kick your ass while I laugh, NO OTHER BOSS DOES THAT, when did we get from "puzzle-bosses" to "enemy/bullet-hell-bosses"), and to top it all, respawning at the very beginning... it was so easy to just respawn you in the phase that you were killed, instead of starting over... yes, it would have been frustrating, but this time you would be fighting the phase that is causing you issues, instead of increasing artificially the difficulty of the fight by having to go through phase 2 again and again. Cool design, cool ideas, very poor execution, this boss should have been reworked a long time ago, or at least, delayed its implementation until the design of the fight was good enough, and then release it in an update, but this was the turning point for me. Also, good luck beating this in Hard Mode and better luck beathing this in Hard Mode + Iron Mode, unless you save scum, you are not going to beat this and preserve your sanity, unless you have a lot of skill, patience and time[/spoiler]

So... to sum up: Great ideas, great world (albeit a little empty), great bosses (most of them), and the achievements are funny, they add an extra layer of difficulty (but not excessive) on how to defeat the bosses, but I cannot recommend the game with the issues that it has towards the end, if there were no achievements linked to completing it in Hard Mode + Iron Mode, I would have no issues recommending it, but if you are a completionist, this game is, in one word, hell, and I'm really sad for this, because I loved this game, I was planning on re-playing it, until it broke me at the end. It had a ton of potential, both for its gameplay, it's oscure story (which I love) and the simplicity of everything

This review got a little out of hand, if you read all of it, thank you for your interest, and if you play the game, play it as you wish and don't feel ashamed for your failures, but feel proud for your achievements

Edit:A few days have passed,I must admit I wrote the review on the heat of the moment,after thinking it better,it's a pity that a game that is awesome gets worse ONLY IN the end.So, I changed my mind, do I recommend this game now? Yes, please,and if you enjoy "souls" games, you will feel at home

author: {'steamid': '76561198166403222', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1703246018}
review:
初见很有旺达与巨像的感觉，
但我想不通的是在全是boss没有小怪的情况下，还有什么跑图的必要吗？
当然逛风景，到新区域，挑战boss，这一套下来是个很好的想法，旺达也是这样的，但很可惜你是否记得自己只是个像素游戏，而且跑图甚至没有引导。。。这里建议直接bossrush
然后玩一会就感觉无论是主角还是boss，一击必杀这个设定很有待商榷，
有的boss招没看完，几秒钟击杀，我甚至不知道自己是不是在偷鸡
boss虽多但每个就一两招循环播放，打中了直接过，打不中就全程躲，操作正反馈太少了，这种情况下你要是卡关了那真的烦燥，还有那个b屏幕抖动，你能不能加个选项让我关掉，攻击一秒画面抖两秒，你要知道大多数抖的时候正好是要输出的时机，我还要找你那个像素点组成的箭头瞄向哪里，要不和怪猎学学你出个耐震珠吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198028067625', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1701666779}
review: With a game as simple and focused as Titan Souls is, any frustrations with the design are damning. For Titan Souls, thats the respawn time. Every hit is a one-hit KO (a genuinely great trend from its era of indie games), but as opposed to games like Super Meat Boy and Hotline Miami, the time it takes to finish dying, respawn and trek back to the boss arena kills all momentum and thrill that the boss fights would otherwise give you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302187024', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2052, 'last_played': 1707511099}
review:
[h1]Tenta se matar antes de morrer nesse INFERNO 😍🥰[/h1]

Que jogo EXCELENTE, eu me lembro assistindo a série do coisa de nerd de Titan Souls (""série"" q tem 2 episódio kkkk), o leon se fudendo contra os boss kkkk eu reassisti aqls episódios inúmeras vezes, era mt bom, mas só fui conseguir jogar nesses tempos, e deixa eu te fala, ainda bem que o leon não terminou a série (e ainda bem q eu esqueci boa parte do jogokk) pq não saber nada sobre os bosses melhora MUITO a experiência, aquela sensação de você descobrir como derrotar o boss fdp sozinho é... INEXPLICÁVEL... 

E caralho, que criatividade da porra que os dev tiveram para fazer cada chefão ser especial de certa forma, cada um com sua mêcanica/forma de ataque diferente, que faz o jogador criar sua própia estratégia para matar, sem falar do design/visual dos bixão, simplesmente lindo, o jeito que eles utilizaram o 3D em certos bosses foi um tiro no escuro mas que deu certo, foi muito certeiro (um tiro de -flecha- muito certeirokk), e tudo isso enquanto eles são "limitados" com um estilo de gráfico relativamente simples, mas charmoso. Sem falar da trilha sonora que é simplesmente fenomenal, parece até regra, jogo de matar chefão=OST simplesmente ÉPICA. 

O conceito de um um hit pra você e para o boss é muito interessante, deixa o jogo de uma certa forma... balançeado? kkk é só acertar a flecha que é vala, mas se você levar sequer UM ataque vc tbm morre kk. 

Sobre os controles do jogo, a jogabilidade é simples e fácil de entender. Único problema é o fato do jogo não ter como personalizar as teclas (se seu teclado não tem as flechinhas você não pode jogar) e além do mais, eu definitivamente recomendo jogar o jogo com um controle, o teclado limita demais a mira da flecha, que multiplica a dificuldade dos bosses MUITO.

Acredite em mim, eu sofri pq eu não sabia disso kklkk Titan Souls tem uma curva de aprendizado relativamente íngrime, você não consegue passar DE JEITO NENHUM de um boss, aí vc passa, pega o jeito, e pronto, tu vira um DEUS em matar aql boss (tem uns boss q isso nao se aplica, continua sendo dificil mesmo depois de horas jogando kk).

Concluindo, o jogo oferece uma experiência recompensadora, não tem como eu não recomendar essa obra-prima, comprei ele antes do reajuste dos preços da steam, então acho melhor esperar uma promoção pq 47 REAIS É DEMAIS. Mas mesmo assim RECOMENDO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060178172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1704753353}
review:
The controls are atrocious on mouse and keyboard. 
I needed to rebind the keys, which also doesn't work well.
The most fun I had was configuring an AutoHotKey file.

Whoever made the PC mouse and keyboard version did not put in any effort whatsoever.
Its a shame. The game could have been good.

The game doesn't render the correct resolution on 4k. 

Every respawn is a quarter minute of walking. 
The game is short.

All in all I wouldn't recommend buying this game for 1 centicent, if you play on mouse and keyboard and don't want to use the arrow keys and c and x.

review: Was fun at first, the achievements made my hairline look like vegetas arches, bosses on hard mode felt more like cheese mode than it was difficult especially combined with no roll and no death, ends up becoming a slog where most bosses instant lose to certain positioning rather than being fun and creative, calling back your arrow is so damn long its actually impressive

author: {'steamid': '76561198082407705', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1667931301}
review: Jogo sensacional. Me passou a vibe de um Shadow of the Colossus hardcore versão pixelada. A ideia de atacar com apenas uma flecha e tomar hitkill deixa os nervos à flor da pele, sem falar em ter que ficar bem atento pra desvendar o puzzle por trás do boss. Espero que algum dia tenhamos uma continuação dessa pérola.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097322047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 519, 'playtime_forever': 2263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2263, 'last_played': 1700834504}
review: Titan Souls игра в жанре Action - испытание на ловкость рук и глазомер. В игре нет никого кроме ГГ и боссов, каждый на своей арене, со своим набором "неприятностей" и тактикой по его устранению. В распоряжении ГГ есть управляемая стрела и нет права на ошибку, потому что босс не промахнется. Можно конечно ловко убегать от противника по арене, но лучше научиться метко стрелять. Игра хардкорная, если вам не жалко своей нервной системы "приятной" игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131419014', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1701667386}
review:
Buena Idea, pero no me termina de gustar la forma en que se llevó a cabo.

La dificultad y los tiempos de espera me terminaron por hartar (conste que lo dice alguien que se ha pasado toda la saga souls)

Yo tenía la idea de un Dark Souls en 2D, y terminé jugando un juego puzzle acción en la que a veces hago la acción correcta, pero el juego decide que no fue lo suficientemente preciso, por lo que no hace nada, haciéndote pensar que la solución no es por ahí.

La verdad los primeros 4 jefes son muy divertidos, pero a partir de pasar de la primera puerta, el juego se vuelve bastante bastante hartante.

No me tomen a mal, no es un mal juego, pero definitivamente no es una experiencia para todos.

author: {'steamid': '76561199221793038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1691967316}
review:
Primeiro: esse jogo custar 47 reais é um absurdo. zerei ele em 6 horas, fazendo o final verdadeiro. até tem um pouco de conteúdo extra depois de zerar, mas nada demais. Obs: peguei em uma promoção.

o jogo é basicamente um boss rush, ou seja, você só enfrenta bosses. O seu personagem não melhora nem um tico depois de matar um boss, o que me broxou bastante, mesmo que eu já soubesse disso.

Agora os bosses são realmente bem legais. Cada um tem uma forna diferente de matar, então isso é um ponto positivo. 

Enfim, o jogo é bom, mas é bem cutinho. definitivamente só vale a pena se estiver em uma promoção

review: Игра пзц какая трудная, но меня больше бесило не то что тебя очень легко убить, но и то что ты воскрешаешь иногда далеко от место босса и тебе нужно тратить лишнее время чтобы дойти опять до этого босса и сдохнуть опять. Да и вообще когда я начал играть я решил пойти дальше и понял что заблудился в этих развалинах, нету ориентиров куда идти, какого боса тебе убить надо, где находится слелующий босс, я просто запутался и пока бродил там и пытался вернутся назад просто выключил игру. Больше и нечего то сказать боссов там наверное море.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002888672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1701269295}
review:
Boss design is fine and intuitive, but the gameplay just isn't for me. It's one thing to stay where you are while drawing your bow, but also stopping while you pull the arrow back to you makes more of a "panically running away hoping the boss doesn't kill you" instead of a "I'm gonna try a new tactic with this boss" experience like dark souls. Adding to that there's no indicator showing where your arrow will actually go. With only eight directions there's a lot of shots missing if you try to stay farther from the boss, which also meansyou it takes longer to pull your arrow back to you.
Might be worth the price if there would be keyboard+mouse support and an option to directly respawn at the bosses instead of having to wait a few seconds to respawn in the starting area and up to another 20seconds running back to the boss.
As is, this "easy to learn, hard to master" done wrong. There's no fun in running back to bosses, seemingly no way to upgrade or fasten the process and the perogative is to learn how not to die instead of how to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198862725299', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1700996604}
review: So this game gave me mixed feelings about it. It's a game where the bosses die in one show and so do you. I'd consider the game more of a puzzle game because most of the time is spent figuring out where the bosses weak spots are and how to kill them. I think at the start the learning curve is a bit too hard as the starting bosses are actually quite hard which can discourage people. Also the check points are sometimes far away from where the boss arena's are. Once you get the hang off the game I think it's actually quite fun to explore the world and all the lore that is quite cool. The true endings is worth the time spent. Overall I'd say the game is okay giving it a 6/10 so I'd only get it if you played death's door and want to support the developers more or if the game is free.

review: honestly, this is one of the best games I've ever played and easily the best boss rush. It's so fun trying to figure out how to kill each boss and then for some even how to get to it, the bosses are all unique and difficult in their own way so the game never gets boring even though you have one mechanic, shoot arrow bring back. I honestly couldn't recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975720697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1700967427}
review: I really wanted to like this game and the basic premise is excellent. But for the love all that is good, devs... put spawn points before the bosses. Forcing the player to run back to the boss room kills the fun of this game which is... fighting the bosses. I spend more time running to them (and slowly for that matter) only to die within a couple seconds. Rinse and repeat. Now I beat 8 of the bosses, so I did enjoy the actual meat of this game. Too bad all the fat made me quit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010077003', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1700957771}
review:
2/5
Videogioco d'azione che potrebbe essere un incrocio tra Dark Souls e Shadows of the Colossus. Detto così sembra una bomba, in realtà non è per nulla.
I nemici, dato che storia nel concreto non ce n'è, sono dei "titani" da sconfiggere. Peccato che senza una storia dietro sembra un po' tutto fine a sé stesso, una serie di boss scorrelati. Il gameplay è invece spinto all'estremo dell'hardcore, si muore tantissimo (quasi 400 morti per finire il gioco) e ogni combattimento dura solitamente meno di 10 secondi, nei quali si muore o si uccide il boss di turno. Alla fine il tutto si riduce a trovare la combinazione perfetta di mosse da replicare finché non si esegue alla perfezione, anche perché la soglia di errore è zero, sia nell'evitare gli attacchi, si per colpire dove necessario.
L'unico punto a suo favore è l'originale meccanica di avere una sola freccia (e quindi un solo colpo) da potere usare e che quindi è necessario recuperare dopo ogni attacco.
Risparmiatevi questa tortura a meno di dovere dimostrare qualcosa.

^^
Preciso melhorar ainda MAIS para avançar na historia e poder falar mais sobre...

review: A trilha sonora é ótima, a gameplay é bem fluidinha e eu curto muito o design dos bosses e do mapa no geral, o maior estraga-prazeres é que frequentemente o tempo que você leva para chegar aos bosses se torna maior do que o tempo que você luta com os mesmos, o que acaba com o ritmo desafiador e constantemente instigante das bossfights. Porém, se curtir bossrush e de jogos desafiadores vale muito a compra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994108754', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1700698171}
review: This game could of been so much more enjoyable if it wasn't for the whole die in one hit thing. More than half the time i spent dying and running back to the boss from the checkpoint. That would have not been such a problem if the spawns weren't so far away from the bosses. Now the bosses have really interesting gimmicks that do make them really engaging to defeat, but the main issue is that they move way too quickly which gives you way too small of a time frame to precisely make your shot at the bosses' weak spots. The world, art style, and soundtrack are all really good, but they can quickly wear out their welcome since you absolutely will be dying very often. This game has a lot of really good things to it, but these 3 major problems will easily make it a far from enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103014378', 'num_games_owned': 1044, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1700342053}
review:
Very simple and small instant death boss rush game that:
> Makes you wait 5 seconds for a fade to black animation every time you die
> Makes you run back to the arenas for another 10+ seconds every time you die
> Has only 2 keys for 4 different actions
> Doesn't even let you rebind them

The simplicity and 1-hit death nature of the game makes you want to retry very fast but the game was not made with that in mind, making the experience very frustrating and unfun very quickly, as there is nothing between the respawn point and the arenas where you can try the fights again but empty traversal and waiting for forced animations. You spend more time going back to the fight than in the actual fights.
There are better and less infuriating boss rush games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044181338', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1699911983}
review:
Très bon petit jeu. 

Le concept est simple mais très efficace, des boss, chacun ayant un point faible, une seule et unique flèche et c'est tout. Le règne du One Shot en somme que ce soit pour eux comme pour vous. 

Bien sur atteindre ce point faible tiendra parfois du miracle tant la fenêtre d'action, une fois les prérequis effectués, est ridiculement courte. D'ailleurs sur ce point, le fait de devoir charger légèrement votre flèche mettra votre frustration (la mienne en tout cas) à rude épreuve. Un délai plus court voir un tir instantané aurait peut être été plus tendre avec mes nerfs ^^.

La difficulté est donc bien au rendez vous mais parfois inégale, certains de vos adversaire se montrant singulièrement plus retors que d'autre. Mais l'ensemble du jeu reste homogène.

L'ambiance est des plus agréable grâce à une direction artistique très jolie sans être sublime et surtout une musique qui elle atteint des sommets.

Bref le jeu qu'il vous faut pour vérifier l'ouverture de vos chakras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110581308', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1699668440}
review:
Really wanted to like this game but man it was bad. Overall nothing about this game felt good. Originally picked up the game and played a little in 2016, but finally got around to really playing it this year after 100%ing DS1. Maybe I went in expecting too much of something else but idk. For what it's worth the game does have a great visual style (why I originally bought it) and sound track. 

And I did beat the game and [spoiler] Truth [/spoiler] so no, its not a "skill issue"

My Issues:
- I was constantly being clipped through walls and the floor while in a fight with several different bosses, which just left me stuck until I died 
- None of the kills felt satisfying, more of just a "ugh, whelp on to the next on" feeling
- Movement felt incredibly slow and rolling just seems useless (maybe with I frames it would have?)
- Killing bosses felt like it was more about RNG than any sort of skill
- Bad hit detection (arrows went clear through "kill" spots but did nothing, getting hit by attacks that you are nowhere close to)
 - If I alt-tab'd in fullscreen mode, the game would softlock and not let me back in the game unless I restarted
- Playing in windowed mode would introduce screen tearing even with v-sync and fps drops on a beefy system 
 - The fact it gave me all missing achievements after beating [spoiler] Truth [/spoiler] instead of just the ??? achievement (could be a Steam issue but at this point idk)

review:
快来和我一起受苦！！！不想游戏内受苦的慎入库。
缺：射箭方向老是对不准，不知道擦边多少次了。如果和我一样菜，你就会发现，每次爬楼梯、攀岩心里是多么地急。
优：不管主角还是boss都是一击必杀机制挺有意思的，至少只要运气好那么一次。这不就反过来验证了：“我可以失败无数次，但你只要失败一次...”

author: {'steamid': '76561198367334175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1699376600}
review:

review:
[h1] 나도 한방, 너도 한방...? [/h1]

수많은 보스들의 기믹, 패턴을 알아 활을 쏴 깨는 게임입니다.
잡몹 없이 깔끔하게 보스들만 플레이합니다.
활쏘기/회수/구르기/달리기 의 전투방식입니다. (플레이는 패드 추천합니다.)

플탐은 초회클 4시간 가량이며, 2회차로 넘어가면 난이도가 상승하며 전체적으로 보스들의 일부 패턴들이 변합니다.
난이도가 다소 있으며 여러모로 도전의식을 자극하는 게임입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378776032', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1703146547}
review:
I haven't had a game spark my interest like this game has in a LONG time, so far I've beat the game and its secret final boss and now doing new game+ hard mode. This game is an easy 8 or 9/10 
Probably one of the best boss rush games I've played to date.
There is only a single gripe I have about this game, in the forest section there is 2 bosses and they take a slightly annoying amount of time to get back to if you die, otherwise all the other bosses are very close to your spawn points.
I got the game on sale for a couple bucks, but I'd say its worth 15$, the devs really deserve it.

TLDR:
PROS:
-Insane replay value
-Tough but fair bosses
-Large variety of bosses, no boss is the same with only the 2 gate guardians being similar
-Exploration and story/lore building that's not obvious but if you look for it you can piece it together
-VERY satisfying when killing bosses
CONS:
-Sometimes it takes a annoying amount of time to get back to a boss, or you cant find a certain boss without a guide (I needed a guide to find "The elder" as its kinda hidden but also its an optional boss, if you want the secret 19th boss you have to find him though)

author: {'steamid': '76561199113601102', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1698713770}
review:
Битнул всех боссов за ночь. Как таковой сложности нет, если знать все паттерны атак противника (а они мега шаблоны, и их заучиваешь спустя 5 минут боя). Буквально, все саундтреки в игре восхитительны, рисовка на высшем уровне.
Из минусов только два - отвратительное управление на клавиатуре, из-за которой руинишь много попыток (но и к ней привыкаешь спустя 20 минут игры), и слегка заметная текстура стрелы, которую очень легко потерять в файте, особенно если она за текстурой. 
К ознакомлению рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058854579', 'num_games_owned': 1145, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1698143766}
review: It's a boss rush game with very gimmicky bosses. Both you and the bosses die in one hit so you just looking few the very very small window of opportunity to hit them with an arrow. Bosses have very limited moves and move a bit too quick which means the game play loop is to go into a fight, die very quickly to the same move that killed you last time, and then spend 10-15 seconds walking back to the boss from the respawn point. You can spend longer getting back to bosses than some attempts at them and you die so quick and easy I don't feel like I have the chance to work out the fight. This is a game which it isn't fun to be bad at. I am not good at hard games but still enjoy lots of them because they are still enjoyable even when losing. Not good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101284946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1697783425}
review:
*in 2023*
It's an okay game and you do get some slight feeling of satisfaction when you beat a boss. It's somewhat to a similar to a souls game in that respect but it also feels like there's more frustration toward a loss when you know how to beat a boss and it simply comes down to the execution. The frustration is made all the more apparent because both you and the boss (in most circumstances) die in 1 hit.

It's very simple which is fine but it the mechanics which consist of shooting your arrow and recalling it do start to wear thin as it goes on. Fortunately the game is pretty short (it took me about 2 hrs and 45 minutes) so it's probably about the right level of complexity for that length. At the right price, maybe $6 or so, it's good enough for a little bit of fun. There is a hard mode that changes up boss mechanics that can double that playtime too. The hardmode does feel more strategic than the normal. 

Bottom line: Decent game, not great. The execution was okay but wears thin as it goes on. Worth it for a few bucks, maybe not full price

author: {'steamid': '76561198042192224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1697707712}
review:
The concept is kinda interesting and the devs are clearly competent from what little I played (with good art design and crisp enough gameplay controls), but the game itself just... Falls flat. You go into a boss, die because you don't realize how it works, then go back and kill it the very next try. The most attempts it took me was on a boss that I didn't realize the mechanic of for killing it, but once I realized what I was supposed to do I beat it first try.

The core gameplay concept seems to be that everyone is either really strong or really weak, and I'm not sure which since you die in one shot... but bosses do as well. After a 5 second boss fight, you get to watch an annoying 15 second cutscene as your character absorbs the soul or whatever? I don't really know because it doesn't make any sense and is extremely annoying since it's a long animation that you can't skip and that happens after every. Single. Boss.

Oh, and you need to remember to find checkpoints before going into bosses or you'll get screwed over. I decided I didn't wanna bother continuing after I finished the forest bosses, ran around and found the snow biome, unlocked a boss there, went in and died because I didn't know the mechanic, then respawned.... back in the forest, so I'd have to run for another 2+ minutes to get back to the area and then spend more time looking for a checkpoint so I don't need to do that again. The game feels like Super Meat Boy if it were only bosses, except you don't get an instant re-start on the bosses and need to run back to them after every life. It's just artificial difficulty/tedium at that point, which is pretty frustrating. The way they work, it'd be a lot better to make the fights a bit more challenging but add a quick respawn mechanic so you're able to spend your time learning the mechanics/fighting instead of spend your time with death animations, running back, and screen transitions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251729140', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1697685755}
review: Imagina jogar Cuphead só que a cada vez que vc morre pro boss, vc precisa ter que andar 20 minutos pra chegar nele, merece a nota que recebeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042625015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1697664003}
review:
I usually like these kinds of games but the checkpoint system ruined this one for me. You can't make a game whose core gameplay loop is based on trial and error and then have a mandatory 10+ second walking session between retries. This would have been a fantastic game if the respawn points were right outside the room you died in instead of three screens away.

I love the art style and the unique combat mechanics but with the way respawns are handled I simply cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129220645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1697599466}
review:
Coming into this game, I wanted a fun, moderately difficult arcade boss-rush.

What I found was a tedious gimmick boss-stroll. Allow me to explain:

Boss fights are typically won/lost within 10-30 seconds. The gameplay generally consists of waiting for a very narrow window of opportunity and then accurately shooting your one arrow to kill the boss immediately.

Unfortunately, finding that window generally takes some trial and error because it is largely a gimmick. 

Worst of all, the walk back to the boss frequently takes more time than fighting the boss itself. 

To be fair, getting the gimmicks and killing the boss feel good-ish. But the "win screen" where you absorb their soul also takes as long as the fight. The time spent with the bosses was simply not worth the time wandering around at a snails pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 753, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1697571868}
review:
It has a pretty cool concept marred by poor design choices.

The game is built around some pretty simple mechanics, you get to run, dodge, and shoot using a bow and arrow; you only get one arrow though, but don't fret, cause you have a power that recalls it.

The basic gist of the game is that you're supposed to beat a number of bosses in a fairly large area, these areas though, don't have maps, and they can be fairly intricate; their design is not that intuitive though -or at least I didn't found it to be that way-, which in turn, made the entire levels feel secretive and intricate, but in all the wrong ways; half of the times I didn't know where to go next. Eventually I did found it though, but here's the thing...

The game is designed around the idea of beating bosses that can kill you in a single hit; but most of these bosses are design as puzzles, rather than actual battles; for example: there's a boss early on that's a brain inside an ice cube, in each four cardinal directions on the stage there are pressure plates and in the center of it all, there's a flame that pops out whenever the boss hits one of those pressure plates; the puzzle? You have to lure the boss to one of the pressure plates, dodge it, and then take advantage of the limited time frame in which the flame appears, to shoot an arrow through it, effectively melting the boss ice cube. This leads to a second phase where the brain chases you around the stage, but then you just have to time the arrow shot to actually hit it, and that's it; that's the end of the fight.

The problem with designing something like this though, is that for every attempt where you're trying to figure out what to do in the fight, you have to die; this doesn't make the victory or the process of actually learning the game fun, instead, it turns it into a punishing excersice in patience; it get's annoying, and it gets annoying quick. With some of the more elaborate boss battles in the later game, this problem becomes, welp... an even bigger issue.

There's also the fact that the checkpoints in the game are abysmal, here the simplistic nature of the experience effectively works against it; by not providing the player with a quick retry, or a simple checkpoint at the start of the boss fight, you're actively disuading the player to retry the encounter again; because -like a top negative review mentioned-, you have to walk back to the boss fight for around "15 seconds or so" each time you die. This might not seem as much, but believe me, it is... it gets extremely annoying to do this.

If you want to know the truth though, what really killed the experience for me was the fact that every boss fight was handled like a puzzle, but you die in one hit, and after a while I just noticed how badly this was working against the game; you need to give time and an opportunity -literally here-, for the player to understand, or try to understand, your fight; but if in each attempt, you punish me, by having to restart the ENTIRE fight again, then my patience gives, and I end up not liking your game.

It's a shame too, because I think the concept is really good, and the aesthetic is really good, plus the music is really good as well; it's just these number of caveats that end up amounting to a much, much more larger issue, and eventually, they ruin the experience.

review:

review:

I suffered through it and beat all of them, after possibly over 200 deaths, because I hate myself and my life, but enjoy that kind of challenge if the boss battles themselves are fun or interesting enough.

Definitely not for everyone and easy to see why many would dislike it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828364847', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1691439581}
review:
[h1] TITAN SOULS [/h1]

[b] Gameplay: [/b] A gameplay de Titan Souls é realmente excepcional, proporcionando momentos épicos e divertidos pra quem joga. Enfrentar os bosses é realmente desafiador mas quando você vence é realmente gratificante.

[b] Lore: [/b] Embora a narrativa do jogo não seja explicita ou complexa, ela pode ser interessante, adicionando profundidade à experiência.

[b] Trilha sonora: [/b] A trilha sonora é impecável e se destaca, especialmente durante as batalhas contra certos bosses. Ela contribui para a atmosfera única do jogo e é verdadeiramente linda.

[b] Gráficos: [/b] Os gráficos são estilosos e a combinação de pixel art com elementos em 3D é bem interessante de ver.

[b] Dificuldade: [/b] A dificuldade do jogo é bem desafiadora, mas dentro da proposta do jogo. não chega ao nível de um Dark Souls, mas você vai quebrar a cabeça pra matar alguns bosses.

[b] Preço: [/b] O preço do jogo é bem alto para a sua duração de 4-6h, mas se você for alguém que gosta de platinar vale muito apena.  Recomendo aguardar por alguma promoção.

[b] Pontos negativos: [/b] Um ponto negativo é a confusão do mapa, que pode fazer você perder tempo procurando os bosses. Além disso, o sistema de morrer e retornar ao ponto de spawn é bem irritante, considerando que você morrerá várias vezes, e pra voltar pro boss dura de 5-10s.

[b] Nota: [/b] No geral, Titan Souls proporciona uma experiência excepcional, marcada por sua jogabilidade envolvente e desafios gratificantes. Apesar de alguns pontos negativos, como o mapa confuso e o sistema de respawn, é um jogo que merece uma nota sólida de 8/10.

review: 342次复活，3小时48分通关。很明显游戏本身的流程可以更长，我才过了16个BOSS，但是可以直接打最终BOSS了我就没有继续去受苦了。很有意思的游戏，很多BOSS的机制也非常好玩，琢磨一通后会发现很多耐人寻味的地方。但是这个游戏怎么说呢，剧情相对弱化，你可以选择只受苦不去看剧情。真正把地图摸透后可以发现一些不错的剧情。自老头环后，少有的让我自己打的这么痛快的游戏了。
