author: {'steamid': '76561198089289691', 'num_games_owned': 2958, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1696738346}
review:
[h1] ¿QUE ES TITAN SOULS?[/h1]
[b]Titan Souls[/b] es un juego de acción y aventura que se asemeja a títulos como Shadow of the Colossus y Cuphead. En este juego, nuestro objetivo es eliminar una serie de jefes uno tras otro. A diferencia de los otros dos juegos mencionados, Titan Souls es más corto en duración. Sin embargo, su nivel de dificultad puede no ser apto para todos, ya que cada jefe puede eliminarnos de un solo golpe.

Cada batalla requiere una estrategia específica, en la cual debemos disparar a los puntos débiles de los jefes con nuestra flecha. A veces, el juego nos indica directamente los puntos débiles, mientras que en otras ocasiones debemos descubrirlos por nuestra cuenta. Aunque los jefes pueden matarnos rápidamente si cometemos un error, también podemos derrotarlos de un solo disparo, lo cual crea un equilibrio interesante y satisfactorio.

Sin embargo, para llegar a ese punto, debemos morir repetidamente en un ciclo frustrante, ya que cada error nos obliga a volver al comienzo y recorrer el camino hacia el jefe nuevamente.

Titan Souls tiene un aura de misterio y su mundo oculta más secretos de lo que parece a simple vista. Sin embargo, su alta dificultad puede alejar a muchos jugadores que no tienen una tolerancia alta a la frustración. En general, no es un juego que agrade a todos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048474642', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1686492355}
review:
Тот самый редкий случай когда Папич был прав: "Тебя убивают с одного удара, значит и ты должен убивать с одного удара" - идеальный баланс. Вдобавок посыпаем все это приятным визуалом, великолепным музыкальным сопровождением и разнообразием действительно интересных боссов (к которым нужно найти индивидуальный подход) и на выходе получаем годную игру на пару вечеров - 8/10.
P.S. Любителям хардкора зайдут доп. режимы прохождения с модификаторами повышающими сложность или ограничивающими геймплей, благо самые сложные ачивки можно абузить через переписывание сейв файла в папке игры

author: {'steamid': '76561199028890618', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1696840865}
review:
It's a pretty based game.
Bosses are unique and all have their own unique gimmicks.
You don't need to fight against a bullet sponge health bar.
After figuring out the gimmick, beating the boss becomes trivial.
Learning boss patterns and their gimmicks in this game is extremely fun.

Except the final boss, the final boss is bullshit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048834816', 'num_games_owned': 2648, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1700683795}
review:
Juego de aventura con toque de arcade al estilo “Boss mode” donde nos sumergiremos en un desolado mundo custodiado por unos inmensos seres conocidos como titanes. Armados únicamente con nuestro arco y una única flecha nuestro cometido consistirá en abatir a estas inmemoriales bestias y reunir sus almas para poder avanzar a través de sus devastados escenarios y encontrar la verdad que esconden. 

Con esta singular premisa el título se sustenta con una base gráfica de estilo pixel art minimalista muy bien realizada donde cada titan así como sus escenarios y ataques únicos tienen personalidad propia y gozan de una calidad y acabado más que digno denotando gran nivel de detalle en el sombreado y buenos efectos tanto lumínicos como de fluidez de movimientos. 
Por la parte sonora podemos hablar de unas composiciones envolventes y variadas llenas de un carácter épico que sumerge a la perfección en la acción y en el entorno con melodías características para cada momento y combate. 
En el apartado jugable encontramos unos controles sencillos donde la acción se traslada a una pequeña serie de interacciones simples que nos otorgan total control y manejo de la situación, creando así un nivel de control técnico y exigente, pero a la vez simple. 
La interfaz se presenta igualmente correcta sin más complicaciones que las directrices justas y los menús y opciones básicos y necesarios para su correcto funcionamiento.

Este es sin lugar a dudas un título retador. El hecho de morir con un simple toque y el tener que reiniciar los combates puede desesperar a más de uno, pero partiendo de la base que el titulo se sustenta únicamente en vencer enemigo tras enemigo en entornos limitados nos plantea un reto en el cual el ingenio y el aprendizaje va unido precisamente al ser derrotado y al intentar nuevas estrategias con las limitaciones que tenemos, muy al estilo de “Shadow of the Colossus”, titulo de cual bebe en casi toda su esencia y del que es claro referente. Además el juego cuenta con cierto nivel de rejugabilidad unidos a diferentes modos de dificultad e interesantes retos para el jugador que quiera superarse a sí mismo. Aunque cabe destacar el hecho de que su rendimiento base es bastante escaso y que su precio hace recomendable su adquisición con descuento. No obstante, y tras lo anteriormente comentado solo queda alabar un trabajo original y bien estructurado que hará las delicias de todo aficionado a los juegos indie así como a los buenos retos. Altamente Recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261817430', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1696089899}
review: Muito bom, cenários maravilhosos, trilha sonora sensacional e uma nova forma de explorar um gênero grande e famoso, toma muita inspiração do Shadow of Colossus numa mistura com Souls like, a principal mecânica de aprendizagem com os bosses do jogo é a análise por meio de tentativa e erro, focando na evolução do jogador pela própria habilidade dele. Foi o primeiro jogo da empresa e meus parabés, valeu cada centavo e ainda vale muito mais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866148693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1659289306}
review:
Esse jogo mudou a minha perspectiva de vida.
Parei de bater em minha esposa, não sou mais alcoólatra, e comecei a tratar deficientes como se fosse seres humanos normais. eu achei o jogo tão incrível que eu fundei com meu próprio dinheiro uma ONG ante-drogas, e me converti para o cristianismo.
Em fim, Acid Nerve & Devolver Digital, obrigado por dar sentido a minha vida, sem vocês eu não seria nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561199204883859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1696097484}
review:
[h1]Pequeno herói cuja a missão é dar lapada em criaturas: The Game[/h1] 

[b]Jogatina[/b]: Tu pode andar, correr e/ou esquivar e atirar com uma flecha igual um índio, os monstro te derruba com uma lapada mas a mesma regra vale pra eles

[b]Lore[/b]: Essa bagaça ta mais sumida que a Madeline Mccain mas ela querendo ou não ta presente em algum lugar

[b]Trilha Sonora[/b]: Tu pode tocar ela numa guerra ou num SPA (não importa kkkkkk) vai combinar com o ambiente

[b]OBS[/b]: Já ouvi uma das trilhas relaxantes enquanto soltava um barroso 

[b]Gráficos[/b]: Estilosos pra caramba (apesar de serem um pouco minimalistas em certos pontos) mas isso ainda é um tremendo charme

[b]Requisitos[/b]: Se o que tu ta usando tem tela vai rodar :)

[b]Dificuldade[/b]: [i]"Aqui o filho chora e a mãe também"[/i]  

[b]Preço[/b]: Pega esse treco numa promoção

[b]Nota: 8.9/10[/b]

[b]OBS[/b]: Seria 9 se o mapa não fosse tão confuso

author: {'steamid': '76561198307149065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1695520280}
review: Great potential ruined by one bad decision: Making me walk all the way back to each boss room to retry a boss fight. The actual fights have all been great so far, but I can't keep playing the game, the one-hit-death gameplay that would otherwise be a fun challenge means that often a boss attempt lasts less time than it took to reach the boss and it's a walk I take many many times before a clear. They're not even short walks, either. It's just so tedious and could trivially have been avoided. I want to like this game but I don't. Don't play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198404558690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1695452274}
review: The game seems like it has a lot of potential to be fun, sporting unique bosses with gimmicks to figure out that are like little puzzles in each fight. There's also a kind of interesting brutality in the fact that both the player and bosses die in one shot, that at first seems unfair until you discover that every enemy you face has this sort of weakness. However, the player's controls break the flow of the game. In an otherwise quick paced, fluid, and time-critical game, the player is forced to wait not only to shoot their arrow (at first simply to shoot, and then to shoot for any distance past their toes), but also retrieve their arrow. During this time of waiting, the player is forced to stand still or abandon the shot/recall. Combined with the tight timing the bosses require, this ends up being an entirely brutal mechanic that only the most dedicated to completion would overcome, especially in the way that it takes away from the fluid dodging and movement that the player has at their disposal. So, while a fun concept and an interesting design, I wouldn't recommend without the player seeing some polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039551877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1694982686}
review:
Take Shadow of the Colossus and make it bite-sized. 

Every Titan has a big, glowing weak spot to find, and you only have one arrow to hit it. But don't worry, you can pick that arrow up or telekinetically pull it towards you. The bosses attack suddenly and far quicker than you, so you'll rack up a number of deaths learning the patterns or going for stylish kills.

Each boss has a simple gimmick to figure out. Moving from boss to boss is satisfying and quick. Traveling the map is where the biggest similarities to Colossus come into play, as with no map and little indication of where the next Titan is, you are left to roam nice looking pixel art vistas before you find the next hub area. The ambient sounds and soundtrack are also quite good, so there is a certain small beauty and grace in navigating the empty landscape.

Also like Shadow of the Colossus, the plot is minimal and implied. There is a secret or two to be found when roaming, but not much to speak of. Defeating the main game will take only a handful of hours, however real playtime will come in for the achievement hunting gamers out there. The real question is if you are sure this is the game you'd like to donate your grind to.

Almost every boss has a unique way to kill them to gain an achievement, so skim the list before starting the game if you want to try to hit them on your first run. After defeating the game, the harder modes are unlocked. I found them a tad too punishing and arduous, even as the masochistic achievement grinder I am. I believe your time is better spent on other achievement-focused games for the grind. Moreover, some of the harder modes can be made easier via save game manipulation to create backups (Brachragon's 100% Achievement Guide can tell you the details if you think the achievements are worth your integrity). 

Overall, fun little game. I had a few good laughs from how brutally the Titans kill the lil guy you play. Get it on sale, get to the end credits, and figure out if you want to donate a 100x more hours to grind those achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123604860', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1640268010}
review:
This is the most unfairly reviewed game I've ever played. I played it some years ago and still think about it, still wanting more of this.
Titan Souls has wonderful graphics and atmosphere (with the titans feeling ancient and majestic, especially the serpent), but the contested aspect is the gameplay, so let's talk about it. The design is absolutely down to the core, expanding on the idea the game sets to explore, which is the challenge of understanding and first hitting a titan in a duel. I don't know why people complain about dying over and over and having to reach the titan again. This structure puts you in a meditative state, and you have time to breathe and calm yourself between fights, also building up the stakes (because then dying actually sets you back, it's not trivial to die).  Stakes and a tight draw towards precision also apply very well to having to fetch your arrow at each mistake. People complain that it's sometimes unclear how to attack some bosses, but that's the point. Staying alive, being careful, observing, experimenting, then landing the hit. No power fantasy here. Then, my friends, the joy from beating every single titan is priceless. Whoever says the game doesn't respect your time or that it's mainly dying and walking is missing the point by far. Some complain that the game is too short, and yes, it is! I want titan souls 2, and 3, and 4, please don't make me beg.
This should be a whole genre: elegant boss rush, without the usual attack spamming and hundreds of options and flashy gadgets. Elegance and tightness of design is something that feels very good, like in chess. This is still a goldmine to be explored in boss fight design.
The only thing I would have loved to see added is more lore attached to each titan, maybe exploring more environmental storytelling or more dialogues (with the few ones that would actually talk).

author: {'steamid': '76561198138409857', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1652199688}
review:
一款硬核的2D像素風格動作遊戲, 遊戲的難度無愧於它類魂的標籤. 遊戲操作就只有翻滾,射擊以及WASD移動. 玩家和BOSS都是一擊必殺. BOSS都有一個弱點,只要用箭射到弱點就能擊殺BOSS , 只是BOSS通常都有不同的特性來保護自己的弱點. 玩家只有一個箭矢.  箭矢射失了能夠召喚回來, 召喚箭矢回來的時候也有傷害. 有不少BOSS需要使用召喚箭矢來擊殺. 遊戲中只有BOSS戰沒有小兵. 因此玩家能夠選擇打BOSS的順序. 甚至如果只是要通關, 可以不需要把所有BOSS打完就能打尾王.  多次嘗試下把BOSS擊殺能帶來巨大的成功感是這遊戲最大的樂趣 喜歡類魂的玩家非常建議入手

Steam 遊戲短評
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43130793-Game-garden/?appid=1966900] Game-garden [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198252367724', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1694095952}
review:
Achei o jogo meio monótono e chato, o fato de não ter nenhum tipo de evolução no personagem durante a derrota dos chefes, não é muito do meu agrado, não sinto que estou sendo recompensado por matar os chefes.
O jogo desde a tela de carregamento mostra que é recomendado a utilização do controle, até ai tudo bem, o grande problema é que não criaram nenhuma opção de personalização de teclas e os comandos não seguem o padrão mundial de WASD, mouse 1 e 2.
Por fim, ainda bem que peguei esse jogo de graça, pois não acho que vale apena 47 reais nele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100911629', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1693856229}
review: The world is well crafted, but it's really annoying that it recommends a game pad after I've already bought the game. Though not enough to make me want to refund it, it could have been said earlier because it made specific bosses twice as difficult due to the limited scope I could aim, if I could have aimed with my cursor it would have felt much better. I feel like bosses can be two different kinds: The ones that can allow you to be creative and take them apart step by step like the Plant Titan, or they can be a matter of just "Okay, so you wanna just aim and hit them on the exact one eyeball socket they got when they get in this exact position, and you got like 1 second window to pull off the shot". Having to go through multiple attempts at specific bosses like the Yeti just because it's not obvious that he's guaranteed to face the center of the arena when he charges is really annoying. The final boss also needed me to look up a guide answer because it's confusing when you're getting spammed by abilities and mechanics that don't actually have anything to do with when they're actually vulnerable. I feel like I don't want to play the game anymore nor bother with the additional difficulties.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258343372', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1693773720}
review:
It was fun for ~30 mins. Normally I am not so hasty to give reviews (especially negative ones), but Titan Souls is very apparent what it is right from the beginning. It's a boss rush and you can run, dodge roll (with no i-frames), and shoot one arrow that you have to retrieve before firing again. 

Bosses will go down with one hit so the game is all about timing and positioning to set up the perfect shot. On paper, this sounds like a cool idea but in-game it doesn't work so well. It leads to a lot of trial and error in which you will get smashed into the ground repeatedly. At times, even when I figured out how to set up the killing hit, it was a tedious process of cat-and-mouse until I lured the boss into the move or position I wanted. 

The game recommends a controller and in this case, I think it is essential and the mouse/keyboard does not allow for the quick moves and dexterity to fire off projectiles accurately. 

In all, the game is hard, but not really fun because the difficulty comes from poor controls and rather monotonous gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108482698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1693761997}
review:
Довольно короткая игра, которая поможет вам приятно скоротать вечерок после работы и расслабиться. Из плюсов:

- Красивая, расслабляющая музыка

review: 全通關花了5個小時7分鐘非常有意義很有成就感（雖然成就尚未拿全）推薦此游戲。這款游戲好像是去年免費贈送還好從某小道消息得知然後免費獲得。昨天因爲無聊入手這款游戲昨晚花了兩個多小時今天也花了兩個多小時還是比較幸運。用手柄玩的流暢但我不習慣，還是給我硬生生打通關前期完全靠感覺打後期看著視頻才知道如何打對全鍵盤的朋友來説會有點小難度建議此游戲用手柄。（本人試過鍵盤有點操作不過來）算然沒有國語但游戲整體風格還是很不錯。（對自己過不去的朋友可以玩此游戲，畢竟操作失誤會被氣死）

author: {'steamid': '76561198064361673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1693045440}
review:
БЕЗ ГЕЙМПАДА В ИГРУ ДАЖЕ ЗАХОДИТЬ СТРОГО ЗАПРЕЩАЕТСЯ!!! 
В игре предстоит ходить и стрелять из лука. На клавиатуре оба действия возможно линейно по 8 направлениям, когда геймпад даёт возможности всех 360 градусов. И в данной игре это играет самую важную роль. Всё остальное даже обозревать смысла не много, вкусовщина и минимализм. Мне больше нравится, чем нет. Однако управление целиком и полностью убило всё желание играть. 
На геймпаде игра будет всё ещё не простой, но такой, какая должна быть. Используя клаву будьте готовы усложнить себе жизнь с миллион раз. Играть в трёхмерный шутер на стрелках вместо мышки, куда проще, чем в этой игре. Вот уж где метка "Контроллер (ПОЛНОСТЬЮ!)" абсолютно оправдана.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260401907', 'num_games_owned': 1964, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1692969303}
review:
[b]Despite having a clever core concept with the single arrow attack, a cool, eerie world and some interesting boss battles that look like small puzzles, "Titan Souls" fails to deliver an entertaining experience. One hit deaths/kills remove the rewarding feeling through improvement and force the player to repetitively walk boring distances from checkpoints to bosses. Open world has no purpose as there is nothing to discover and the story is so abstract that fails to provide any motivation. Also, the gameplay doesn't evolve at all and gets monotonous with the slow charging bow that almost ruins battles' pace. Bosses look generic and you'll soon forget them all. "Titan Souls" is hollow, pretentious and at some points extremely annoying.


Manometer: 4/10[/b]


The good
- Cute, orthographic, pixel visuals with nice colors and some cool details here and there.
- Nice world with a peculiar, eerie atmosphere. It feels right from a beginning like a lonely journey.
- Great calm music that fits to the visual aesthetics and enhances the atmosphere. Epic music during battles is awesome.
- Smooth, responsive controls. Your commands and actions are accurate enough.
- Fluid animations. Protagonist's movement, enemies attacks, objects that get destroyed and flying particles are very pleasant.
- Bosses seem a bit generic but they're well designed. Each battle is like a small puzzle that you have to find the solution and enemy's weak point in order to win. Some boss battles have clever mechanics.

The bad
- One hit deaths force you into a boring routine. Most of the time, you have to walk annoyingly long distances from the checkpoint to the boss. It gets even more frustrating during the first tries that you die within a few seconds. Also, in other (souls) games each time you replay a battle you feel like getting better. You learn patterns, you stay alive more time, you evolve strategies and gradually you feel stronger. Here, you don't feel like improving. You play again and again mechanically until suddenly realizing what you have to do or even doing it by accident. There is no feel of really achieving something.
- I really don't know what's the point of the open world if it's actually a boss gauntlet. To force you walk? To make the game look bigger? Its world is beautiful but empty. You don't find real secrets, collectibles or story hints. It's just the space between the bosses. There is no exploration value at all and you end up just boringly walking from dungeon to dungeon.
- Too abstract story and shallow lore. I feel that abstraction just covers its hollowness, but even if there is something in there it's too hard to connect the pieces. There is no escalation at all and it does'n even give you basic info at the beginning. You don't know who you are, where you are and what's your purpose. You just move aimless killing titans for no reason. The game feels so secretive that gets pretentious.
- The idea of a single attack is interesting, but the bow charge is slow and retracting the arrow is even slower. It almost ruins the pace of the battles.
- Gameplay doesn't evolve at all as you play. You don't acquire any skills, abilities or weapons. There are no builds. You do the same single thing till the end so it can get monotonous after a while.
- It's no rewarding at all. Beating harsh bosses gives you absolutely nothing. No loot, no story revelations. Souls that you gather aren't currency or collectible. They're a just a visual trick. You don't feel like having the motivation to beat the bosses.
- Bosses are cool visually, but they look a bit generic without having to support a specific story. You'll forget them all soon.
- It uses only two action buttons, so I don't get why roll and run have o be connected at the same button. Just use a third one. There are only few more annoying things in gaming industry than knocking on stairs after a roll, while you just wanted to dash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139007497', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1692832827}
review:
Игра - один из немногих редких шедевров самих в себе.
Дизайн игры выполнен на отлично.
Геймплей строго минималистичный, но при всём при этом глубоко продуманный и разнообразный, а каждая отдельная битва кардинально отличается от предыдущей. Зачёт!
Лор нетривиальный и лежит далеко не на поверхности, как и подобает лору в таких играх. Зачёт!
Добавить ещё разные плюшки в виде новой игры+ с новыми сложными режимами и незаурядных достижений.
Саму игру прошёл полностью и даже чуть больше за день, пройти до титров можно, наверное, за полдня.
Короче, надо брать!
Короче, надо бра

author: {'steamid': '76561198041863212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1692212493}
review:
This game is the souls game of all Titans . . . yeah. So the game starts off kinda simple and easy, but then it starts showing you that you're gonna have to try hard. It's been a long time since i've been so into the combat of a game. Everything is practically one shot, except some bosses, and so are you. The combat feels short, quick, but not too quick. The game was hard for me finish on normal with over 200 deaths. . . well even if i say that it took me about 4 hours to kill everything there was to kill. And no im not going back for the harder difficulties. I've been challenged enough and i enjoyed my time, so i would like to keep it as a good memory, not a frustrating one.

Overall a difficult game that sometimes seems pretty complicated, but you have to remember that it's actually simple and if you're missing something it's probably your shots or you're not looking hard enough.

review:
难度较高，趣味性强，有点考验反应和运气。
不多BB，上来就是打BOSS，你和BOSS都是一滴血，来嘛，玩的就是一个心跳。
像素风的小清新画面，论场景美观什么的没得说，怪物也是活灵活现，颇具压迫感。
缺点有两个：虽说风景好看，但是地图太大太空了；另一个是激光双拳这个BOSS。

author: {'steamid': '76561198084402844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1691952252}
review:
this game looked promising BUT the mechanics are really problematic. 

you got you single arrow you must charge to fire (making you unable to move) with poor aim controls to hit a almost pixel perfect spot and then you either go there yourself to retrieve the arrow or you can "suck it back" (you hold a button and attract to arrow back to you while unable to move). you an also roll and run, but it feels like youre gliding on soap.

titans always one-hit-kill you and you got to expose yourself to danger, shoot and escape right away (because titans dont feel your hits; they just keep coming).

there are too many hardships to overcome at the same time combined with bad controls on a gameplay that asks for nothing less than perfect timing.

maybe if you didnt have to recover that single arrow every time or could fire while moving or your shots could push back or slow down titans... just one of these would feel like a huge improvement on gameplay. 

you can try fighting titans in any other. i did slay one and didnt seen to receive any visible power up, so im guessing theres none. all the titans ive tried outran me easily, chase me relentlessly and had a single window of opportunity that allowed me to hit them with a perfect aim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095146108', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1691949938}
review:
It's a good game, really like this hard boss rush type of game. Definitively worth the time and money.

The only problem i see with the game is the fact that you have to walk all the way to the bosses after every try. That's a little bit annoying, and made a lot of players drop this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054844785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1691944189}
review: VELMI povedená hra. Je velice obtížná, ale když víte jak na to, je to už jen odpočinková hra (až na achievementy: VELICE TĚŽKÉ např.  dohrajte hru na těžkou, počkat ne, na T.Ě.Ž.K.O.U obtížnost bez jediné smrti). Nevím kdo dělal ten soundtrack, ale zaslouží si Nobelovku. Šestadvacet nádherných a sedících skladeb. Více o hře: vzbudíte se na opuštěném místě a tutoriály jsou pro lamy. Doslova máte 3 obrázky tlačítek ovladače (tahle hra je stvořena pro ovladač, hrát tuhle hru bez ovladače je sebevražda, dokonce jak spustíte hru, máte nápis: Gamepad is strongly recommended for this game) a to stačí, konec, hrajete. První věc co uděláte je, otevřete dveře k prvnímu titánovi, tahle hra je založena na porážení bossů, žádní normální nepřátele a musíte vždy najít slabinu titána (trefit se) a střelit. Nicméně po otevření těch nádherných dveří (grafika je nádherná), první věc co uděláte, probudíte tu potvoru a umřete (pokud nejste zkušeným hráčem). Dávám 10/10. Doporučuji všem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198884656370', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1691944159}
review:
Nossa senhora que jogo bom, essa ideia de kit kill tanto para você e para os titan é muito bom, o jogo não tem historia ele apenas te apresenta o combate. Se você for jogar apenas para zerar, jogo não vai te apresentar muito conteúdo, então o certo seria você pegar ele para platinar mesmo, dai você aproveita tudo oque ele te oferece.
 O combate é muito bem feito, ficar pensando na abertura do titan enquanto você morre mil vezes é muito divertido.

Sobre a rapaziada que deu negativo no game e abandonou só por conta dos comando do teclado, não faz o menor sentido, é estranho no começo por andar na setinha, mas isso nem sera incomodo para você depois de 5 minutos, os comando é bem simples, então nem precisa ficar esquentando a cabeça com isso.
 Estou tetanddo platinar o game no teclado mesmo, ja que estou sem controle no momento.

author: {'steamid': '76561199069064292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1691077237}
review: I've come back to this game a couple of times to beat it again and I admit it has it's flaws. With that said, it's a great game to hone your spatial skills, timing and most importantly how to look for weaknesses in video game bosses. It's strictly a boss rush game so there isn't much content outside of boss battles but that's to be partially expected in this type of game, however the pixel art was beautiful so travelling from boss to boss wasn't too much of a chore. Creative, cute and at times, brutally punishing

author: {'steamid': '76561198130173220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1703878127}
review:
整個流程幾乎沒有任何文字或提示，自行探索與攻略敵人的弱點正是我認為整個遊戲最精隨的部分
尤其是最後一道門前的 [spoiler]靈魂 [/spoiler]，自己發現弱點並擊破的成就感非常高
此外在美學與配樂上相當優秀，遊玩過程中不妨停下來靜靜享受

推薦不偷看攻略，搭配搖桿遊玩([b]絕對不推薦鍵盤遊玩[/b])

author: {'steamid': '76561198091305077', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1691161563}
review: Once you beat the first boss you already know everything this game could possibly throw at you. The entire game is a series of cheap, gimmicky bosses in a boss-rush format. Get hit once, die immediately. You move frustratingly slow, your attacks are frustratingly slow, and every win requires proper strategic planning. Frankly, it's a turn-off having all three of these things at once. The game at once wants your character to control in a slow, deliberate fashion, and the bosses to be frenetic, fast-paced races to the finish. If the game made your character move and attack just a *little* faster relative to the bosses, this would be a charming and challenging experience. As it is, it's just pure rage for no reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063926607', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1691148477}
review:
Imagine the worst bosses in souls series and you are fighting them in a boss rush format. This game is basically it, not the mention that you have just 1 arrow and it takes forever to pick it back up. You also have just 1 hp just like the bosses so experimentation isn't really possible if you don't want to die.

If you respect your time and money just don't buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168165122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1690560125}
review:
Игра вышла на пк а вот только без нормального управления,для комфортной игры, нужен контроллер... На ПК ;)
Бегаем на стрелочки - это ещё нормально
Но вот стрелять из лука и обратно подтягивать стрелу на "Х"
Терпимо,скажете вы?
Да,если бы кувырок не был на "С"
Лично я не знаю как выворачивать пальцы для комфортного управления,большой палец на "Х",тогда я не могу одновременно использовать кувырок и стрельбу, средний и указательный палец на "Х" и "С" тогда мой мозг не может обрабатывать информацию что когда нажимать а по-другому я не знаю как мне тыкать на кнопки ...
Через боль, (в прямом,блин,смысле,во время написания у меня болит большой палец) я всё-таки прошёл первого босса,он вообще не сложный,знаете что тут действительно сложное?
УПРАВЛЕНИЕ,МАТЬ ЕГО ЗА НОГУ!
Это так глупо,ведь это не боши к примеру,хотя и там в одном из самых сложных платформеров управление удобнее!
А тут,мне обидно что такая интересная игра,ведь она выглядит очень приятно те же анимации чего стоят,звук классный,внешний вид соответствует... Но блин тут всё портит управление и невозможность его изменения...
Или его всё-таки можно изменить?
Можно вот ссылки на способы :

https://steamcommunity.com/app/297130/discussions/0/618459405707071625/

https://steamcommunity.com/app/297130/discussions/0/3076503022332644321/

Но там нужно скачивать софт,танцевать с бубном а я уже расстроен,за столько времени можно было выпустить фикс,ведь на длс с музыкой и артами сил хватило ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198254178645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1690483567}
review: So I liked the gimmick of the game where all bosses have 1 hp and you also have 1 hp so it becomes a boss rush puzzle type of game, but i tried getting into it 3 times now and every time i quit out of frustration. The boss fights are fun, but the game makes you run back through an ugly, empty world every time you die in a boss fight which is pointless and punishes you for a small movement mistake. There is nothing challenging or entertaining about running back for 30 seconds through an ugly world every time you die, and you will die a lot while you figure out timings and patterns of each boss. I quit this game 3 times out of frustration now, and every single time I did, it was not because of the hard bosses themselves but the boring walk. I do not recommend this game, not for 19$ CAD, not for 1.9$ CAD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040557732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1498506147}
review:
[h1]The linked review essay is about Acid Nerve's later release [i]Death's Door[/i], but also covers the comparative strength of [i]Titan Souls[/i] near its conclusion.[/h1]

[. . .] Unlike [i]Death's Door[/i], [i]Titan Souls[/i] feels like it has a hook, a great mechanical system that serves as its focus. And that hyper focus of [i]Titan Souls[/i] on taking its barebones combat and fine-tuning every encounter around it means that it’s able to excel at that one task. [. . .]

[url=https://thegemsbok.com/art-reviews-and-articles/deaths-door-acid-nerve-review-pros-cons/][Click here to continue reading this review][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197967815270', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1482288650}
review:
Titan Souls is a boss rush game that pits the tiny protagonist and their bow against gigantic enemies in pixel art arenas. 

The idea is solid - each titan is basically a puzzle, they die in one hit but so do you, so you have to identify where the weak point is and find the opening in their attack pattern. Everything is small so accuracy is tough and missing means you'll have to slowly call your singular arrow back over to you while dodging the titan's aggressive onslaught.

Gameplay is fast paced and challenging to start with but never really evolves beyond the same single mechanic. It's designed to be over as quickly as possible and while there can be a bit of a mad scramble between the start of the fight and figuring out how to deliver the killing blow there isn't much substance to the encounters other than roll-dodging for dear life. 

While my instinct is to be hard on this game I have to appreciate that it came out of a small gamejam project which was polished and tidied up for steam. It feels like a small dame dev portfolio piece, but the price absolutely reflects that so just be aware you're getting what you pay for, albeit respectably polished and good for a short single playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561199076269275', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1690294104}
review:
Dans les Souls, il y a toujours une impression de rigueur, de talent, de progression constante. Dans Shadow Of The Colossus, les colosses dégagent une impression de majesté, de mélancolie, dans des environnements variés qui traduisent un lourd passé. Et pour Titan Souls, qui s'inspire de ces géants du jeu vidéo, c'est vraiment dommage de ne pas retrouver ces points si iconiques.

[b][u]Points positifs :[/u][/b]
- [u]Presque jouable sur Atari :[/u] Deux boutons, deux joysticks, c'est tout ce qu'il vous faudra. Un gameplay très simple qui offre plus d'options qu'il n'y paraît.
- [u]Foire aux monstres :[/u] Là c'est sûr, il y a de la diversité niveau design. Cube, serpent ou champignon, vous serez toujours surpris par ce qui va vous massacrer.
- [u]David contre Goliath :[/u] Ces choses résistent à vos flèches et font dix fois votre taille. Et pourtant tout comme vous, elles meurent d'un seul coup bien placé ! Ce simple fait rend le jeu (parfois) très satisfaisant et rééquilibre un peu la balance (voir ci-après).
- [u]Remue-méninges :[/u] La dimension de casse-tête n'est pas anecdotique, et une telle prise de risque est à saluer, d'autant qu'elle rend leu jeu plutôt unique.

[b][u]Points négatifs :[/u][/b]
- [u]Esquive la balle ! :[/u] Comme tous les boss vous tuent en un coup et sont pour la plupart assez rapides, vous n'aurez souvent pas le temps de réfléchir ou faire des tests que vous serez déjà mort. Embêtant dans un jeu où la réflexion et l'expérience sont centrales.
- [u]Violence gratuite :[/u] La difficulté, c'est un fait, mais Titan Souls traduit une sorte d'acharnement (non intentionnel) envers le joueur. Les boss qui continuent à vous molester pendant que vous êtes écrasé au sol, des éléments superflus qui vous pourrissent la vie (Le boss est trop simple ? Ajoutez des traînées de feu !), un compteur de morts qui n'a aucun intérêt... Bref, si le jeu est là vous vous sortir de votre zone de confort, c'est clairement sans bienveillance.
- [u]Souliers usés :[/u] Vous passerez probablement plus de temps à courir qu'à combattre. Entre la zone centrale gigantesque mais vide, l'absence de téléportation, et les dix secondes passées à chaque mort pour revenir jusqu'au boss, c'est rapidement lassant. Et contrairement aux Souls qui ont un principe similaire, ici vous mourrez maximum 10 secondes après avoir commencé le combat, et surtout...
- [u]Tout ou rien :[/u] L'aspect énigme se réduit bien trop souvent à un timing précis ou un tir sans faille. Contrairement aux boss des jeu cités en intro dont vous ferez toujours descendre la barre de vie plus bas à chaque essai, rater sur Titan Souls ne vous apport plus rien après quelques essais. Vous vous contenterez de soupirer quand vous arriverez enfin à vaincre ce satané boss. Surtout les quelques boss qui comportent des aspects "aléatoires", qui ne vous apporteront aucun accomplissement.
- [u]Tout ça pour quoi ? :[/u] Bonne question. Titan Souls n'a pas vraiment d'histoire, et le boss sont loin d'être majestueux, et ne donnent pas l'impression d'être d'autres êtres vivants et sentients. Vous allez devoir inventer votre accomplissement après les nombreux essais nécessaires à chaque boss. Et si l'instant fatidique où l'écran se fige à la mort d'un boss est vraiment classe, cela se termine par vous qui devez faire les chemin à pied en sens inverse en laissant derrière, vous l’énième statue qu'est devenue le corps du boss.

En résumé, Titan Souls est un boss rush sans véritable histoire, dont l'aspect unique (les énigmes) se tarit souvent au profit de la chance et des mécaniques. Son style de jeu nerveux amène malheureusement une certaine lassitude, la faute à des combats trop peu engageants et de longues minutes à courir dans un monde vide. Le jeu aurait sûrement profité d'un mode invincible pour les amoureux de la réflexion s'il ne lui était pas nécessaire de rallonger sa durée de vie par une difficulté plus que sérieuse. 
Si vous voulez profiter d'une ambiance poétique et d'une B.O. tout aussi sympa, vous pouvez regarder Death's Door, du même développeur avec le même compositeur, qui lui vaut vraiment son prix.

BOM PRA CARACA, o jogo tem uma dificuldade elevada para querer jogar o pc no chão e pra quem gosta de sofrer, ainda mais se você decidir platinar. As mecânicas são simples e funcionam bem, tendo praticamente uma mecânica para cada boss. A arte do jogo é FENOMENAL a pixel art é incrível e o design dos bosses é de cair o cu da bunda junto com aqueles detalhes 3D super bem colocados.
Eu particularmente AMO esse tipo de jogo desafiador e recomendo muito o jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038139937', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1689997807}
review:
This game could be great, but it tries to be Shadow of the colossus and fails horribly.
The wolrd is HUGE filled with nothingness, you just walk around trying to find the next boss.
Once you find the boss you will die over and over until you figure out how to beat it, and each time you fail you have to take the walk of shame back to the boss. No enemies, no nothing, just your time being wasted every time you die just to try again.
And last but not least, the achievements are ridiculous. Most of the achievements are challanges "kill X boss in Y seconds", "kill  the boss pulling back your arrow", etc.
If you just want to beat the game you will get an whopping 4 or 5 achievements out of 27.
You are not Dark Souls, you are not Shadow of the Colossus. Just let us try the boss again instantly and cut out the huge world, no one cares about it, seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108144738', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1689110684}
review:
PRO: Stile, difficile, gameplay unico, breve
CONTRO: Poco memorabile, nessuna trama
VOTO: 8/10

---------------------------------------------------------

Nonostante sia degli stessi autori di Death's Door, che ho amato, fino a non molto tempo fa non mi sarei neanche immaginato di poter dare una chance a un titolo come Titan Souls ma invece eccomi qui.

La prima cosa che salta all'occhio è la pixel art eccezionale, con ambientazioni pazzesche e un buon level design, purtroppo sfruttato solo negli spostamenti in quanto privo di nemici, enigmi o collezionabili. La qualità del comparto tecnico si estende anche alle animazioni molto fluide e alla buona, seppur non troppo memorabile, colonna sonora. Ci tengo inoltre a far notare come i testi siano in italiano, nonostante Steam dichiari il contrario.

Peccato invece per la storia, che di fatto è assente ad eccezione di una breve frase pronunciata da un boss segreto. Personalmente questo è un aspetto a cui do molto peso e avrei gradito anche solo un minimo di contestualizzazione delle azioni, che invece rimangono solo fine a sé stesse nonostante la grande epicità.

In ogni caso è ovviamente il gameplay ad essere il fulcro della produzione e ne è forse anche l'elemento di maggior pregio. Titan Souls consiste in un boss rush in cui bisogna sconfiggere 19 titani (diversi dei quali opzionali o segreti, più uno presente solo nel New Game + e uno sbloccabile tramite un workaround) nell'ordine che si preferisce (eccetto in alcuni casi), essendo ognuno di essi confinato in una singola arena accessibile dal mondo di gioco, che assume quindi la funzione di hub. Tutti i nemici sono diversi per meccaniche e aspetto, pur non risultando mai iconici come quelli di Death's Door (anche se ce n'è uno molto simile).

La peculiarità di questo titolo è che si uccide o muore con solo un colpo e si dispone solo di un arco e una freccia. Quest'ultima può essere caricata a piacere (i colpi potenti richiedono però molto tempo per essere eseguiti) e poi recuperata passandoci sopra oppure richiamandola a sé a distanza, permettendole quindi di infliggere danni anche durante il ritorno.

Non è tuttavia sempre vero che basti un colpo per sconfiggere i boss in quanto diversi di questi necessitano di una "preparazione" per esporne il punto debole (anche se spesso non richiedono attacchi diretti). Ho notato inoltre come questi possano essere divisi in due categorie: da una parte ci sono nemici semplici da leggere e schivare ma che non si capisce come sconfiggere, dall'altra ce ne sono alcuni di cui è subito palese il funzionamento ma che sono letali.

Si tratta infatti di un gioco molto difficile, che sono tuttavia riuscito a completare al 100% in circa 4 ore, nonostante le ben 266 morti all'attivo. A peggiorare la situazione c'è anche una prospettiva non sempre chiarissima, in particolare per quanto riguarda la profondità e la distanza dal terreno degli oggetti che cadono, gestita solo con le ombre.

In conclusione, Titan Souls è un'opera impegnativa ma appagante, grazie ad uno stile eccezionale e ad un game design unico. Peccato solo per l'assenza di una trama a giustificare le azioni, che rimangono quindi limitate ad una pura sfida tecnica. La sua brevità e la divisione in arene separate lo rendono perfetto come passatempo estivo, oppure come intermezzo di un titolo più grande.

VOTO: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198096186960', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1700013290}
review:
Nun ja, wer es geil findet ausschließlich Bosse zu besiegen die auf dem One Hit=Kill Prinzip basieren hat mit dem spiel sicherlich viel spaß, um fair zu sein haben alle Bosse auch nur ein Leben wie eben der Spieler, was sich aber dennoch nach verschwendeten Potenzial anfühlt, da sich die Bosse nicht mit unterschiedlichen Angriffsmuster erweitern/entwickeln. Nach jedem Tod muss man übrigens wieder den ganzen Weg zum Boss laufen (circa 10-20 Sekunden pro Tod), was auf Dauer sehr zeitintensiv sein wird. 

Dass das Spiel ein Soulslike ist war vorher klar, aber bei einem angeblichen Action-Adventure habe ich mir auch Rätsel und Story gewünscht, dies sucht man hier vergeblich, sodass es nur ein Soulslike mit Action Elementen ist.

Für eine Retro/Pixelart-Spiel kann man schon mehr erwarten. Das Spiel macht so ziemlich alles falsch, was z.B Cuphead (ebensfall sehr schwierig, aber faire bosse wenn man die angriffsmuster lernt) richtig macht. Es fühlt sich einfach verschwendet und billig an.

Und dass es noch einen Hardcore Mode (was jeden Boss doppelt so schwer macht), sowie den Iron Man Mode gibt, wo man nur ein Leben hat lässt es noch lächerlicher, unfairer und repetetiver wirken wenn man alle achievements haben möchte.

author: {'steamid': '76561199287904351', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1697502766}
review:
Titan Souls, uma obra-prima desenvolvida pela Acid Nerve e publicada pela Devolver Digital, é uma jornada épica e visualmente deslumbrante no mundo da ação e aventura. Lançado em 2015, o jogo nos cativa com sua simplicidade singular e seu apelo estético que transcende os limites do imaginável.

No coração de Titan Souls reside a majestosa elegância gráfica que nos transporta para um reino de maravilhas desoladas. Cada cenário é meticulosamente detalhado, banhado em cores e iluminação impressionantes, criando uma atmosfera imersiva que envolve nossos sentidos a cada passo. Os Titãs antigos, os formidáveis chefes do jogo, são criaturas de beleza assombrosa e design imaginativo, cujos movimentos fluem com uma graciosidade fascinante.

A singularidade do combate é uma verdadeira obra-prima em si mesma. Controlando um herói destemido, armado apenas com uma flecha e um arco, embarcamos em uma jornada empolgante para desafiar os poderosos Titãs. Embora possa parecer uma situação desigual, é esse aspecto que confere ao jogo sua genialidade; a simplicidade das armas cria uma experiência tática e estratégica incomparável. Cada batalha é um duelo emocionante, exigindo coragem e precisão para identificar os pontos fracos dos Titãs e alcançar a vitória. É um ballet de habilidade e agilidade, onde a dança mortal entre o arqueiro e o colossal se desenrola com graça e tensão palpáveis.

A ausência de tutoriais excessivamente intrusivos e a exploração livre adicionam camadas de encanto à experiência. A liberdade de descobrir as mecânicas do jogo por conta própria, explorando o vasto mundo com sua arte exuberante, incentiva a curiosidade e recompensa o espírito aventureiro.

Em síntese, Titan Souls é uma obra-prima artística e de jogabilidade que nos envolve em uma odisséia visualmente cativante e emocionante. A simplicidade estonteante do combate com a humilde flecha e o arco eleva a experiência a patamares singulares de elegância e inventividade. É uma dança exuberante e corajosa entre herói e Titãs, estampada no esplendor gráfico que nos mergulha em um mundo de deslumbrantes maravilhas. Titan Souls é uma experiência como nenhuma outra, onde beleza, desafio e magia se entrelaçam para criar uma obra verdadeiramente inesquecível.

author: {'steamid': '76561199085404204', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1689452127}
review: É um ótimo jogo para quem procura um desafio. Extremamente inspirado em Shadow of the Colossus, a trilha sonora e pixel-art são impecáveis, e dão uma imersão perfeita ao jogo. O game só peca no port de teclado, pois a jogabilidade não é tão fluída quanto no gamepad, podendo atrapalhar o jogador. Ainda assim, é possível zerá-lo sem muitos problemas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300108270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1689449644}
review: Falta uma história marcante e uma motivação mais clara para o personagem/jogador, além do boss final secreto ser totalmente anticlimático e vibe "final de história cult japonês" que não colou para mim. Porém, jogo é muito divertido, possui uma estética bonita misturando elementos 2D e 3D, boa física para um jogo do tipo e trilha sonora top. Minha nota: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198200975898', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1689266440}
review:
This game is one or two MINOR tweaks from being an absolutely amazing time, but the combination of handicaps in this game against you just makes it feel unbalanced and unfun for ME. Your only attack being in MY opinion bad makes the whole game not feel great to begin with. The fact you have to charge your shot everytime, your character is an absolute moron and only has 1 arrow so you have to either run/roll to your 1 arrow everytime you shoot the damn thing or call it slowly and die waiting. I'm not saying make the game super easy, just balance 1 of the few things that make it for me unbearable to play.  

Either slow enemies by like 1/6th (not my preferred fix), have more than 1 arrow, have the arrow come back immediately OR not require super precise shooting with a half second to look, aim and shoot (half second combined) without a proper precise tool. This is a game that feels like it becomes much easier if you can aim with a mouse and actually hit what you are trying to instead of going for the closest general area and having to die 12 times because the shot barely missed.

This game annoys me a lot because I know if you adjusted like one thing in a more balanced way I'd LOVE it, but as is. I can't play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279171325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1688852347}
review: Titan Souls es un juego simple pero difícil. Me gustó el final de los tres jefes, uno tras otro (me costó más el primero que los otros dos). Algo negativo es que el juego no tiene minimapa y te perdes un poco buscando los otros jefes. Otra cosa que no me gusta es cuando moris y el respawn esta lejos del jefe, ya que es un juego donde se suele morir demasiado. Me sorprendió que cuando terminas el juego se desbloquea el modo difícil, Jaja, pensé que ya lo estaba jugando.

author: {'steamid': '76561199073816330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1688799791}
review:
19击杀
138次死亡
通关时间2：28：25
真心难这游戏，点名批评森林迷宫，在游戏容错率这么低的情况下每次重生都要赶一大段路只能让玩家更加烦躁，90%的时间都是在赴死的路上，真正和boss较量迂回的时间真的很少，除了弱点明显的boss外我不得不上网查攻略来打。还有骑士是我觉得整部游戏最难的boss，昨晚直接给我干到删游戏了，今天重新下回来再次挑战应该是在第五次的时候射出去的箭刚好弹回身上，才终于把boss干掉，只能说运气成分占很大部分。现在我就把游戏卸载，以后再也不会碰了！！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198272019210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1688758624}
review: This game is hard af until you figure out the gimmicks. Every boss only takes 1 or 2 hits to kill but they have unique attack patterns with very short windows to hit their weak spot. You also move very slow relative to boss attacks and have ZERO Invincibility frames. Overall the game is pretty unique and can be fun for a while but do get ready to rage hard. Only downside is it's pretty short. I'd say 50% sale price is worth it. I would definitely not pay $15 for a game from 2015 That also has so little content, but thats just my opinion. Again not bad, but lacking content for the price.

review: Simplesmente não existe como um jogo inspirado em Shadow of the Colossus ser ruim. O estilo de arte é bem simples mas esteticamente muito bonito e o 3D que deixa as coisas ainda melhores. Além da mecânica de One-Hit-Kill que deixa o jogo extremamente divertido e desafiador.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364896942', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1581399757}
review: 致敬旺达与巨像，缺点主要有二：其一是地图太大太空且缺乏合理的引导，玩家全靠摸黑找路才能来到boss房；其二是boss战的设计不够合理，鼓励玩家在开局的十几秒内完成击杀，限制了玩家周旋和观察的时间，加之不管是键鼠还是手柄都很难做到全向的精确操作，战场都只局限在一个狭窄的平台内，玩家和boss的性能差距实在过大，boss战难免从立回沦为不断的运气重开

author: {'steamid': '76561198412187241', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1688633155}
review:
Представьте, что вас латной руковицей взяли за яички и начали неистово их крутить и тянуть, и во время этого вам нужно прицелиться, натянуть стрелу и выстрелить в мишень, которая каждые 2-3 секунды либо пропадает, либо бешено дергается.
Такое удовольствие вас ждет, если у вас нету геймпада.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965385972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1690241102}
review: Love this game, I grew up on SNES it has that look, but obviously plays differently. Its a shorter game, but there is replay value in both achievements and new modes unlocked. I had free access for years through PS+, I have since built a PC and gave up that subscription, and was happy to pay (on sale) for this game I had already played through. Bosses are varied in their mechanics, fun to discover their weak spots and exploit them. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198450345569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1688003527}
review:
i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

titan souls is a indie souls-like action-adventure game featuring 2D pixel graphics that was developed by acid nerve and published by devolver digital. acid nerve us a two-person team from manchester, UK and titan souls was their debut game. it was originally created for the ludum dare game jam, but over the course of the next 6 months, it was ported from adobe flash to a new engine, which enhanced graphic capabilities and improved performance, with more titan fights being added as well over the course of development. it was first revealed by devolver digital in june 2014 at E3. in march 2015, devolver revealed the game would release in april 2015. on april 14th 2015, titan souls was released on PC, PS4, and the PS vita. a android port was later released in june 2015. 

titan souls is a strategic top-down action-adventure where you only can take one hit before dying. the bosses also only can take one hit, but they have specific scenarios that need to be met in order to be defeated. you also only have one arrow, and you need to retrieve it after shooting it. titan souls has been cited as an early example of a souls-like game, but i think it has enough to set it apart. it has simple controls, and a large variety of boss fights, as well as featuring high amounts of replay-ability. there's a good degree of difficulty, which will inevitably lead toa  lot of deaths. i enjoyed the difficulty, as it felt very rewarding to get hard achievements or taking down a memorably hard boss with a really weird mechanic that took me forever to figure out how to kill. i could see some people complaining that the controls are overly simplistic, or that the game's boss battles are extremely repetitive, but i genuinely had a lot of fun.

titan souls is only $14.99 full price, with 90% off sales coming repeatedly marking it down to only $1.49 which is a really great price. this is now the sixth devolver digital game i've completed, having previously completed hotline miami (2012), gods will be watching, expendabros, sigils of elohim, the talos principle (2014). as of june 2023, i have seven more devolver games still to complete now, with potentially more to add to those seven should i purchase more of their amazing game catalogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275955163', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1675157707}
review:
Juegazo, si te gustan las boss rushes debes jugar éste jueguito YA mismo.

Tiene un tiempo ya, pero no se le notan apenas los años, con mecánicas simples pero bien llevadas, gráficos bonitos y escenarios llamativos, y muchas peleas, aunque pueda ser algo corto. Sobretodo si juegas muy bien, pero primero tendrás que agarrarle el truco ;)

Un must have. O must try cuanto menos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139363901', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1687786098}
review:
Just because i's hard, does not mean it's going to be fun.
While fun to look at, the bosses often only have 2-3 moves because there are so many.
The mechanics, again, while simple, seem to remain exactly the same, never evolving. You as a player need to evolve.

Having only the cardinal directions limits the shooting, but doesn't affect the arrow returning, meaning there is a huge trade-off. The returning arrow mechanics is honestly just unfun, but when it hits just right, the small dopamine hit is pretty good.

I'm personally un-invested as well. I'm just a nameless shmuck with a bow and arrow.

If you're looking for the boss-rush-esque thing it has going on, can deal with dying and running back to the boss being your most of your playtime, you're in a great place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136444531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2039, 'last_played': 1687484345}
review:
Titan Souls очень опасливо высказывается на новые темы, из-за чего опасно близка к тому, чтобы получить ярлык «демейка Shadow of the Colossus». Хорошие идеи, вроде иероглифического языка, который мы вдруг начинаем понимать, прозрев по итогам истинной концовки, или открытого мира (в нем нет ни жизни, ни достопримечательностей, и ничего не указывает на то, что в его исследовании вообще есть смысл), в Titan Souls просто не находят достаточного развития. Секреты, которые она таит, на деле куда менее секретны, чем можно себе представить, а в повторных прохождениях есть смысл разве что для спидраннеров, способных превратить бой с любым боссом в отточенное до безошибочности выступление.

Впрочем, как раз в этой роли Titan Souls исключительно хороша. Усложненные режимы, прорва трофеев-достижений… Да, это все на любителя. Но так можно сказать и про всю Titan Souls как таковую.
Несмотря на блестящее исполнение, Titan Souls не хватает мяса, чего-то такого, что подарило бы изобретательному босс-рашу надежный контекст. Это хорошая игра, но порой чрезмерная лаконичность ее совсем не красит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198956410419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1687198154}
review: 死了三百次，死的一半多都在找角度，你问为什么？因为键鼠玩家只有八个方向可以射箭还不能改键，而boss的弱点的位置不一定在这八个方向上。最后两个boss我愿称之为手柄广告，但是键鼠玩家永不屈服！时长不是很准，因为有一半的时间在逛淘宝看手柄。

author: {'steamid': '76561198166874743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1710607179}
review: Рекомендую всем тем кто хочет разбить свой геймпад)) Если без шуток эта игра в стиле Souls игр, ну оно и понятно, в названии Souls, ну так вот. Это довольно хардковый инди проект со множество боссов и локациями. Что говорить про геймплей самой игры, он достаточно однообразный, но разнообразить его можно тупо встретив нового босса. Новый босс новые проблемы. У каждого босса разные атаки, и разные слабые точки. Тут у всех 1 жизнь, либо ты его либо он тебя. У тебя есть, лук, стрела и перекаты, а если ты встрелил, то тебе нужно будет подобрать эту стрелу, либо же притянуть, ибо она у тебя одна. Сюжет так же присувствует но он скрытый. В целом эта игра для хардкорных людей, не все смогут играть в такое. Удачи!! (Я прошёл даже в хард моде)

NOS SEXO JUNTOS . EU NUNCA CONTEI MINHA MAE SOU GAY PORQUE CHINA CONSERVADORA GAY VIOLENCIA RUA PORRADA BEIJING . ENQUANTO SEXO GAROTO BRASIL E MUITO BOM ME SINTO BEM MAS SINTO EXTREMAMENTE CULPADO CONSCIENCIA ENQUANTO ALCANCO CLIMAX ORGASMO . MUITO CULPADO QUE PEGO TELEFONE E DISCO MAE CHINA . author: {'steamid': '76561198159301825', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1687101310}
review:
记得自己第一次玩的时候就被史莱姆劝退了。

时隔几年重新打开这款游戏，甚至用手柄玩，花了两个多小时时间最小程度地通关了一周目（一共只打了13个Boss）。

艾尔登、只狼和仁王2极大增加了我玩这一类游戏的耐心。几款魂的话可能只有只狼更像这一款游戏一点（只能硬上，升级并没有那么大的用处），但游戏机制风马牛不相及，基本上没办法把这一款游戏和我之前玩过的任何游戏进行类比。只能说是多年以后感到还算满意的一款游戏。

手有点痛。

author: {'steamid': '76561198064137477', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1686943703}
review:
4.5h with no guides, 310 Deaths - that's the playtime you can expect; and the frustration you can expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090938080', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1638484227}
review:
Titan Souls is a game where every encounter with the bosses becomes a high-stakes battle of precision and strategy. The "1 shot 1 kill" mechanics add an exhilarating twist to the gameplay, especially when you consider that these bosses require a single well-placed shot to defeat. It's an incredibly satisfying feeling to take down these formidable foes in such a challenging manner.

Each boss in Titan Souls possesses unique mechanics that not only test your skills but also provide a decent level of difficulty. Overcoming their various strategies and patterns requires careful observation and strategic thinking.

The game provides an enticing gameplay experience, but just know that some achievements make playing the game literal hell, so if you want to 100% the game, please take note of this. 

The game also has a great visual aesthetic. The art style and attention to detail bring the bosses and environments to life, enhancing the overall immersion and adding an extra layer of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235062292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1687326594}
review:
Amazing game, well designed, great art, tight control. Has a few glaring flaws which make me not want to recommend this. 

1. No option to rebind controls. God forbid you play on PC this uses one of the worst control schemes to exist : Arrow Keys and Z X
2. EXCRUCIATINGLY LONG RESPAWNS. If you die to an enemy (and you will die, often) the time taken to get back in the fight is frustrating and it gets worse as you progress. This is not a game meant for normal people, if you have a LOT of patience or too much skill to 1 try each boss, go for it. Otherwise I would not recommend this title even though I've enjoyed it and will probably come back to it again and again till I beat it. 

In the current build it is [b]broken on SteamDeck[/b], killing a boss force quits the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045603400', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1686083634}
review:
Una de las principales preocupaciones que encontré en Titan Souls fue el tiempo que tardan los puntos de reaparición, lo cual puede resultar frustrante. En algunos casos, te ves obligado a recorrer la mitad del mapa para enfrentarte nuevamente al jefe al que estás intentando vencer. Esta mecánica puede llevar a una sensación de repetición innecesaria y prolongar la duración del juego más de lo deseado.

Otra cuestión a tener en cuenta es que, desafortunadamente, la mitad de los jefes del juego no resultan divertidos de enfrentar. Esto puede afectar negativamente la experiencia general, ya que los encuentros con los jefes son una parte fundamental del juego.

Además, jugar con teclado puede ser limitante, especialmente debido a la falta de opciones de dirección clara. Hubiera sido preferible que el personaje pudiera apuntar con el mouse, lo que permitiría una jugabilidad más fluida y una experiencia de calidad similar a la de jugar con un control.

En resumen, Titan Souls tiene algunos aspectos problemáticos que afectan su disfrute. Los largos tiempos para volver a pelear con los jefes, la falta de diversión en algunos de sus bosses y las limitaciones al jugar con teclado.

author: {'steamid': '76561199002426288', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1648488480}
review:
Very short and charming game, and a must-play if you enjoy boss rushes, or the analytic trial and error process of dark souls bosses (note that there isn't much else in the game besides this, so at least be ok with those). The pixel art is pretty charming, and although there isn't much story the game holds a specific theme and feel very well. Each boss feels original and well-designed, and there is a nice problem-solving loop you go through when dealing with each new challenge.

Be fairly warned though, it can be *frustratingly* challenging, so if that's not your cup of tea then this won't be for you. I also think the game is fairly pricey for the amount of content in it (although go ahead if you want to support the devs' great work), but the game often gets a whopping 90% discount, so just wait for one of those to grab it, because at the discounted price its 1000% worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799215456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1685811609}
review:
Resumo: Um ótimo jogo pra quem gosta de Shadow Of the colossus ou Dark Souls, gosta de um desafio e tem paciência pra morrer até entender a forma de derrotar os bosses.

Esse jogo é simples, leve e gostoso de jogar, não demora tanto pra zerar se você tiver paciência e tempo livre, as músicas e cenários são muito bem feitas e dá pra ver carinho e detalhe em tudo nesse jogo.
Os bosses são muito bem pensados, e alguns parecem difíceis no começo mas eles te fazem pensar em como usar a mecânica do jogo e do próprio boss pra passar, oque se torna divertido e gratificante quando consegue matar. (embora alguns bosses tivessem muita coisa acontecendo na batalha ao mesmo tempo, então pra matar ele acabava precisando de um pouco de sorte pra conseguir o ângulo certo sem ter nada pra te matar ou atrapalhar enquanto carrega o tiro).
7.5/10

review:
Vms la, o game é bom sim, porém, o preço dele atualmente esta mt salgado(46,99), antigamente o preço dele era mais justo(20 e pouquinho), esse joga é DIFF no  inicio mas depois que vc pegar alguns padroes fica mais facil, achei super legal que depois que vc zera o jogo tem outros modo de game deixando mais diff o jogo como por ex o sem dash.
O jogo se joga no teclado(setinhas) ou controle, acho que poderia ter uma opção para trocar comando. Eu joguei no teclado n sei se foi por isso que achei bem diff para zerar o sem dash, eu demore entre 3-4 horas para zerar a primeira vez. ele é bem divertido com uma promoção acho que vale apenas comprar sim.
Recomendo:7/10(preço atual mt salgado)

author: {'steamid': '76561199100097901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1685566006}
review:
Um ótimo jogo pra passar o tempo matando alguns bosses, frustração e diversão nas medidas certas. Os designs e as artes do jogo são bem bonitos e a música combina funciona muito bem. Um jogo focado no seu timing não é exatamente o estilo de combate que prefiro mas ainda deu pra passar umas boas horas.    
 
Recomendo para quem gosta de matar alguns bosses em seguida, e relaxar depois.

author: {'steamid': '76561199076721007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1702029327}
review: The game isn't what you expect when you hear soul-like. in this game you one-shot bosses if you hit them in their weak spot so they turn out either too easy or too hard and frustrating. if told more detailed about the fights, you go to fight a boss you die instantly because you didn't know what to expect, die a few more times trying to memorize his attacks and figure out where to shoot (bec the bosses are invinceble exept for their weak spots and sometimes the shield thats protecting the weak spot) and then you just realize how little progression that gave you and that you didn't learn any useful skills or knowlege to use aganist the next bosses. also forgot to mention, you'll have to walk to the boss area for 5-10 seconds every time you die (one hit) while the fights fully last at most a few minutes, so in the end this whole list makes the game very boring, frustrating and just not enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003321420', 'num_games_owned': 1348, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1684951163}
review:
🔵[b] Requires light tinkering [/b]

To fix resolution problem change the "high DPI settings" of the game executable:
- Find the game executable TITAN.exe on your system (manage > browse local files).
- Right-click the executable, then select Properties.
- Switch to the Compatibility tab and click on Change high DPI settings, under "Settings".
- On the new window, under "High DPI scaling override", activate the checkbox: [✓].
- Select Application from the dropdown menu and confirm with OK.
- Click Apply, then OK on the Properties window.
- Launch the game.

Tested on: OnexPlayer Mini Pro 6800U

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42772030-Handheld-Friendly/] Follow Handheld Friendly [/url]

review:
jogo bem bacana,
oque mais me surpreende é que eu costumo não gostar de jogos difíceis mas eu me diverti muito com a experiência dos recompensantes desafios desse jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044518882', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1684539801}
review:
You walk the first time and learn one trick of this particular boss. "oh so the boss does this, ok!"
You walk the second time and learn that the pillar which you are hiding behind can be pierced by the enemy's weapon.
You walk the third time and discovers that the boss also have a secondary weapon...
You walk the fourth time and manage to get a shot, but you have no precise aim since the game is a twin-stick shooter and mouse isn't supported...
You walk the fifth time...
Seems to me that it tried to do something similar to Shadow of the Colossus, but SotC compensate the lonely walking by being amazingly beautiful, the first of it's kind, and having no one-hit deaths so you can manage to learn about the boss without unnecessary walking every single mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082613902', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1684518515}
review:
Fun little boss-focused game. The full price is a little steep for how simple and short it is, but I got it for like 4 euros which was more than fine.
My only complains would be that rolling into stairs bounce you off, it might make sense physically but is annoying as fuck, all the boss stages are flat so this only affects traversing anyway.
The 2nd small complaint would be the “final” boss, next to all previous bosses which felt well designed, interesting, sometimes even innovative, the “final” one was just spam this move and die over and over again until the enemy RNG is suiting and then shoot him. I even looked online whether there’s something more to his movements that I missed, but nope all the guides were super short/fast so my brute force solution was indeed correct.
The Truth boss on the other hand was a nice surprise, probably the best in the game.

You can recognize some of the gameplay concepts, ideas and soundtrack melodies brewing here, that were later reused and and improved in Death's Door. If you haven’t played Death's Door then I highly recommend starting with that. It's an objectively far better game, longer, with a proper story, actual gameplay in between bosses etc.

Technical notes:
- runs well on Steam Deck
- getting 100% achievements is hard and requires heavy replaying

author: {'steamid': '76561198153440554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1705103056}
review:
Perfeito,
Nível de dificuldade bom, mecânicas simples, funcionais, e divertidas, e ao mesmo tempo complexas, levando em consideração a necessidade de criar estratégias e decorar padrões únicos de cada titã. (é divertido pra speedruns tbm)
A história é contada discretamente, e tem uma plot meio "shadow of the colossus", mas fica bem aberta a teorias.

Finalmente, em relação aos visuais: o protagonista tem um visual bem mínimo, e causa um efeito de inferioridade em relação aos titãs, mostrando o tamanho e o poder da criatura, que morre com 1 flechada :o

Recomendo muito, apesar de ser relativamente curto, algo nele me faz sempre ter vontade de rejogá-lo com um desafio diferente

author: {'steamid': '76561198030451917', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1682725241}
review:
EZ GAME LUL

Real talk though, it was a pretty easy game. Finished all bosses in 5hrs (Truth Ending). 

Personally think it's mis-tagged as a souls-like because there's nothing souls-like about it. I think you'll enjoy it much more if you approach the game as a puzzle boss rush. All the bosses have a weak point where it only takes one hit to beat, just have to figure out each one's gimmick of how/when to hit it.

I will say I did have few complaints but overall really not a bad game. For sure, it's super tedious running back each attempt even if it is a short distance. Game can definitely benefit from a fast-retry. Some of the bosses were just dumb and obnoxious, but still was satisfying most of the time getting the dub.

Obviously as with any game on Steam, you should really get it on sale especially since it gets dirt cheap. I think it was free in the store page one day so I nabbed it but it was entertaining enough to recommend. I don't see how the additional modes you unlock after beating the game would be fun at all so I didn't play them LOL but initial play-through was fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047854942', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1684104241}
review:
Le jeu est bien mais bcp de problèmes.
Déjà la caméra on voit jamais l’entièreté des arènes ni les boss; y'a des alertes sonores mais c'est pas agréable le jeu étant déjà difficile. La roulade et la course sont sur la même touche ça crée pas mal de situations nulles ou tu te jettes dans un ennemi.
Les secousses de caméra sur le boss de lave m'ont rendu dingue je l'ai cheese pour en finir plus vite tellement ça me donnait mal au crane.
Et le plus gros défaut du jeu c'est que la mécanique de base (en l’occurrence avoir une seule flèche qui s'appelle reviens) n'est pas vraiment utilisée dans la plupart des cas ou en tout cas n'est pas le meilleur moyen de tuer le boss.
Tout le reste est agréable surtout le style et la musique du jeu mais certains boss sont assez difficiles et la façon de les buter fait souvent arnaque à cause de la rapidité des combats et leur côté tout ou rien.
