author: {'steamid': '76561197995220422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1684067057}
review:
The fights are short and often frustrating, swiftly killing you without notice until you learn through dying how to handle each fight. 

There's very little to this short game, so don't expect to get much mileage out of it.

However you slice it though, it gives the incorrect input prompts for a dualshock controller, and that always means a negative review from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087697597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1684027022}
review:
If you don’t have lighting fast reflexes this is a game where you will spend more time respawning and running to the boss rooms than in the actual fights.

The game’s main gimmick is an arrow which you must shoot and then call back to you. Both the shooting and the call back can hit the bosses. 
For most bosses you’ll need to aim extremely precisely on a controller (the game is unplayable on a keyboard because you can’t aim with the mouse) on an extremely small timeframe because you will constantly be dodging.

If you are not into rage games, this game is not for you. 
To give you an idea of the difficulty, as of the time of writing this, despite it being a short game, looking at the steam achievements only 15,9% of the players have managed to get to the final boss area, while over 50% had finished the 1st area.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991189097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1683776962}
review:
I was torn, but I chose not to recommend it for two reasons:

1) The respawn time is just too long, especially when combined with the walkback.
2) The final boss feels unfair.

To be clear, I beat the whole thing, and I can see why people might love this game. The mechanics are, overall, well done, and it's incredibly challenging. But the tedium of waiting between tries at the bosses really kills the pace, and that, coupled with how *ridiculous* the final boss is... just not a game I will come back to. :-/

author: {'steamid': '76561198301707455', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1683893832}
review: Сама идея того, что ты можешь убить босса с одного удара стрелой... только если ты сумеешь попасть в уязвимую точку... и то, что он может убить тебя с одного удара - это что-то интересное и новое. Да, это сложный босс-раш для многих игроков, но было бы интересно и можно было бы посоветовать. Но знали бы вы как меня утомляло и раздражало постоянное бегание. Мееееедленное бегание. В итоге, вроде как круто, но вроде как утомительно и скучно еще до битвы с боссом, и не компенсируется чем-то еще интересным, вроде истории. Немного сырая, как по мне. Но гораздо лучше чем мне, зайдет ярым любителям боли и страданий. Я, может, вернусь добить достижения, но если говорить об оценке, то это тот случай, когда "какого хрена тут нет нейтрального пальца?" ...ну а раз так, то мое СУБЪЕКТИВНОЕ - "нет".

author: {'steamid': '76561198229276164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1683687808}
review:
Trilha sonora o ponto forte, pouco desafiador e bem chatinho, só o ultimo boss de complicado.
DERROTAR os Boss com 1 hit em 1-3 tentativas de 5-15s é horrivel, não tem conquista não é satisfatório hit kill dessa forma
Level design simples. sala -> sala-> sala-> sala->boss
Comandos são mais ou menos no controle mas no teclado é impossível, notei que alguns colegas tinha um "ain" na suas flechas, era perceptível elas fazendo uma curva brusca ou simplesmente acertando depois do inimigo passar dela.
Rolar e andar rápido no mesmo botão é de um nojeira sem tamanho, eu só queria subir as escadas correndo mas não! Preciso rolar e depois correr, fora a falsa sensação de velocidade, ROLAR é muito mais rápido que correr porém, não da pra rolar escada a cima.
Bugs de chefes repetindo o mesmo movimentos mas sem brecha pra ataca.
Hitbox é bem chata 
Poderia ser 2h30 de jogo se não fossem os chefes bugando os movimentos e a exploração que tentei fazer

author: {'steamid': '76561198308801538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1682969338}
review:
Atmosfera: 3/5
Idea: 4/5
Realizzazione: 2/5

Recensione difficile, gioco carino ma un po' insipido. Comparto artistico buono, musiche rilassanti, ambientazioni godibili da esplorare ma completamente vuote. Trama inesistente, c'è giusto un filo di lore non particolarmente impegnata. Ottima l'idea di combattere solo boss, ho iniziato il gioco per quello, non so cosa mi aspettassi ma il risultato non mi ha detto granché. Non c'è progressione, non ci sono potenziamenti, non ci sono armi, non c'è nulla, solo noi con una freccia e i boss, one shot per one shot. Che come idea sarebbe stata anche una gran figata se non fosse stata ridotta ad un pizzico di riflessi a contorno di una non indifferente dose di fortuna. Cerca il punto debole del boss nel caos, non farti spiaccicare, non farti sfiorare neanche un pixel, cerca di azzeccare direzione e tempismo della freccia verso la palla rosa del boss, fine, molto trial and error. Caricamenti e tempi di respawn lunghi un secolo e una corsa molto lenta tra checkpoint e boss. Nulla più, è questa la difficoltà. Direi che non basta far morire di continuo e avere boss "difficili" per essere ispirati ai Souls. Boh, consigliato se fortemente scontato, ma se c'è una demo provate prima quella.

Che poi si gioca letteralmente con due tasti ma non ce li si può impostare e il mouse non è contemplato... relativo eh, but why?

author: {'steamid': '76561198029610672', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1683656107}
review:
That's crazy, man, a perfect distillation of everything I dislike about Soulsborne gameplay (go in, lose to unknown mechanic, die, slowly respawn and walk all the way back, do it on repeat until all unknown abilities become known and also a mechanically successful fight occurs) combined with a respawn-and-return charade that take 10 times as long as the boss fights, win or lose?  Can't believe I don't enjoy this.  

People who get satisfaction or some sense of completion out of beating hard Souls bosses will love this as it does away with all the pretense of mook encounters and grinding - although not the tedious walks back - but if you don't enjoy that gameplay loop in the first place, prepare for a more agonizing and aggravating version of it here.

review: Sinceramente é um jogo muito top, na moral. Mas eu recomendo ele para quem realmente tem paciência pra poder morrer várias vez até descobrir como derrotar os "chefões". Eu mesmo derrotei somente três até agora, e surpreendentemente o que eu derrotei com mais facilidade foi o cubo com olho que solta um raio lazer, foi tão fácil que eu fiquei até sem acreditar na hora ksksksksksk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117372957', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1683490199}
review:
Personally, I found the difficulty level just right. 


I managed to beat the game in less than 2 hours, died about 100 times, and it was a highly enjoyable and distinct experience. Those who complain are either easily frustrated, bad at the game, overreacting, or all of the above. Just dodge for about 30 seconds and land a single hit on the boss. Also, the short walk (5-10 seconds) back to the boss after dying is not noticeably tedious.


Overall, it's a fun and unique game that offers a satisfying challenge without being excessively punishing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391600708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1685434487}
review:
In this game you play as a character who only has a bow and arrow to his name. This on the other hand can be used in many different ways. A slight twist to the usual games is that the bosses were one hit one kill, which gave a feeling of equality as well. I was a fan of the difficulty and never found it hard enough for it to make me want to quit.

The atmosphere in this game was spectactular. The art that creates the world, the music playing in the background and the enemies that create the world all contributed to a fantastic game experience.

I really enjoyed every bit of this game and definitely reccomend it if you're looking for a short and challenging adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143257798', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1683186457}
review:
Feels like a foundation for something really good, but all the little details are missing.
Respawn takes 15 seconds if you include walking
the environment is plain and flat (so far), Walking is boring
bosses AND you are 1-hit kill, which means you die a bunch by necessity then instantly kill the boss when you learnt it which feels weirdly unsatisfying.
You can only aim in cardinal directions in keyboard which is...why? Everything i fought so far needed good accuracy that I don't have due to bad controls. It doesn't feel like my fault, but the game's

The weird thing is that all of those things can be fixed quite easily, make me respawn in front of the arena, Spice up the map, Make it so beating a boss gives you a 1-hit shield for 3 lives, And most importantly let me rotate my aim

author: {'steamid': '76561198016991944', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1683089178}
review:
TLDR:
This game is cute for lack of a better word to encompass most of it, music is stellar, gameplay is for the most part fun save for a few enemies requiring very precise timing/aim, story is almost nonexistent. Worth the full price and fun 4.5 hours I got out of it.

The basic idea of "you have one arrow, every boss dies on "one hit" and so do you" is a fun gimmick on paper however it becomes annoying as all hell when you have bosses that require you to shoot once to open up their weaknesses and then call the arrow back, pull the bowstring, AIM that shit correctly and shoot at a VERY specific weak point all in the span of like A SECOND. Knight Elhanan is the most egregious example of this. While some of the boss' puzzles are easy to understand as "oh hit that part" some others make you go ??? what do I do here ???, Onyxia has a big shinning purple tail but it is hard to hit so it makes you wonder if you're even SUPPOSED to hit it or if you're meant to do something with the side crystals/your arrow/the icebergs/etc when it REALLY was "just shoot it".

The game suffers a lot from the walk back between a boss and the respawn point, even if walking back is just 10 seconds it makes you go "wish I was just there already". If I am too benevolent I can think the devs wanted to give the player a few seconds to cool off their brains on the way to the boss but a part of me feels like it ended up being more annoying than helpful as it would take the "momentum" out of you.

I enjoyed the walk from one area to the next, it is downright criminal how good the soundtrack for the game is, almost like it is too good for this game. Not that this is a bad game but the soundtrack being such top shelf stuff is almost jarring.

Plot-wise it is OK, just a ginormous OK. The plot is nearly non-existent as you just start the game and start blasting, all bosses have weird glyphs instead of names unless you play through the game wise but unless you're into the harder challenge of NG+ (I'm not) you would never find out their names unless you looked it up on a wiki and honestly why WOULD you care for their names, you meet some of them for less than 30 seconds before moving to the next one, their impact on your is almost proportional to how long you were trying to beat them.

I think my favorite joke/bit/whatever from the game is how, every time you beat a Titan and consume their soul there's this grandiose animation of you eating the soul and becoming a whole ass being of light for a split second until your character stops levitating and goes back to just being a lil' guy, the super titan soul changing NOTHING in you looks/gameplay wise. I found it funny at least. That and the fact that if you try to roll UP stairs your character just FLOPS/bumps into the stairs.

author: {'steamid': '76561199146130746', 'num_games_owned': 1285, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1691102136}
review:
вступление
Titan Souls — это игра с боссами с уникальной концепцией: одна жизнь для вас и ваших врагов. Всего есть 18 + 2 босса, каждый с разной степенью сложности.

Плюсы:
- 18+2 босса
- Новая игра плюс с модификаторами для тех, кто хочет бросить вызов

Минусы:
- Нет поддержки мыши - прицеливание с помощью клавиатуры затруднено
- Некоторые боссы кажутся несправедливыми, и для их победы требуется удача.

Стоит ли покупать эту игру?
Да.
Если вам нравятся сложные игры с боссами, смело покупайте эту игру со скидкой 90%. Однако обязательно играйте с контроллером.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253186651', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1683095097}
review:
passei mais tempo andando (repetindo o caminho até o boss) do que, de fato, lutando. é um jogo bem frustrante, principalmente pq o combate todo é baseado em 1 hit 1 kill, isso serve tanto pros inimigos quanto pra vc, ent vc provavelmente vai morrer algumas vezes antes de entender o que tá acontecendo e vai ter que repetir sua caminhada até a batalha. em compensação, a maioria das lutas são interessantes e despertam sua curiosidade sobre como atingir o ponto fraco das criaturas. os gráficos são bem bonitos mesmo hoje em dia e as músicas foram a coisa que eu mais gostei.
dito isso, jogo bom. não jogue se n tiver paciência.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030978836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1683074608}
review:
A surprisingly fun, if simple, boss-rush game that is somewhat reminiscent of Dark Souls. But I would describe Titan Souls more as an action-based puzzler. You die in one hit but so does the boss, and you've got a single reusable arrow to kill the boss with. When you get into the rhythm of feeling out the boss' moveset and learning their patterns, it becomes a somewhat zen-like experience as patience becomes your best strategy.

Due to the nature of the game mechanics, bosses can range from surprisingly easy to frustratingly difficult depending on how quickly you can figure out the ideal way to kill them. Most bosses felt fair and understandable, with my only complaint being the [spoiler]image[/spoiler] boss which had so many mechanics going on (and a misleading sound cue) that I had to look up how to find the weakspot. I also seemed to be able to cheese two of the bosses due to them being unable to reach me when I stayed at the south end of their rooms, which was unfortunate. For the most part though it was satisfying learning how to properly defeat each boss.

The reviewers complaining about the runbacks to the boss rooms are blowing things out of proportion in my opinion. This is nowhere near Dark Souls levels of runback. The longest one is maybe 20 seconds with most of them being around 5, and you don't have to deal with the annoyances of dodging enemies and losing resources on the way there. Plus the death and revive animations are nice and short. I never felt frustrated playing this game, and I get fucking livid at some of the Dark Souls runbacks.

Speaking of Dark Souls comparisons, the game unfortunately doesn't let you pause. Please let us pause our games, developers. I don't understand this decision.

Would I buy the game for $15? Probably not, but the game goes on DEEP sales to about $1.50, and for that it's a steal.

[h1]My Rating: 3/5[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198087000489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1682977311}
review:
Whilst the bossfights are not badly designed, being instantly killed by them is not fun if you cannot immediately restart the bossfight, having to walk back from the savepoint becomes very tedious. The true ending battle is among the best in the game, in part because it automatically restarts the fight. I also find that the controls annoy me, having both sprint and roll on the same key sucks, I want to sprint but not roll, please. 

The way this game handles fullscreen, at least on Windows, feels very crappy. Switching to FS is slow and messes with the scale of your desktop (which screws up the window sizes of other apps you have open), and for the higher resolutions it fails to center correctly on my computer, forcing me to play on lower res. 

The idea of the game is not bad, there's just a lot of implementation details that make it a chore to play. I got this game for 2 euros at 90% off so I really shouldn't complain, but at full price of 20 euros I wouldn't say it's worth it.

The music is good, and the graphics are nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561199103590118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1710875634}
review: This thing is a childhood favorite of mine. When i was really little my parents bought it for me to play because i wanted it for the cool idea of fighting titans, and I was immediately in love. Everything from the beautiful pixel graphics, to the fights which i was terrible at winning, to the art mosaics and lore that I never did understand. I just got it on sale and I love it all over again, especially the music - the beautiful, soothing melodies and awesome, empowering boss music alike. While i's by no means my favorite game ever, it definitely holds a special place in my heart that I 110% think that it has earned.

review:
Продал девственность этой игре за 55 рубленных.
Пожалел ли я об этом? - Не, 1.9 часов ненависти к всему, что причастно к данной игре, ради кайфа прохождения.
Игра рекомендует играть в себя на джостике. "Ерунда" - подумал я. И очень пожалел, что не сходил в DNS и не купил джостик от Xbox (или какой-нибудь дешёвый). Если бы была возможность поменять назначение клавиш, то мог бы и потерпеть. Но играть впервые на этом управлении...
Если у вас есть друзья, которые бесконечно зовут во что-то играть (как я), то порекомендуйте им поиграть в эту игру на клавиатуре.
[hr][/hr]
[h1] 8.5 / 10[/h1]
- Добавить хотя бы переназначение клавиш. (Да, всего лишь [strike]2 ёбаных[/strike] кнопок)

author: {'steamid': '76561198897978375', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1682087712}
review:
Жаль, что нельзя поставить нейтральную оценку. Играть на клавиатуре просто напросто невозможно. Вполне возможно, что я ещё изменю своё мнение, но в данный момент мне кажется, что меня заставляют вышивать в варежках. Стрельба на 8 направлений очень неудобна, не знаю, можно ли на геймпаде нацеливаться, но на клавиатуре это выглядит невозможным. Да даже можно простить эти восемь направлений если бы дали возможность настраивать управление, потому что я бы очень хотел поменять кнопку рывка и атаки местами, но не могу. 

Если слегка обобщить, то игре бы я скорее поставил "нейтрально", чем "не рекомендую", но к сожалению такого нет. Мне дико нравится концепция игры - непрерывные относительно сложные боссфайты, можно сказать, колизей. За это +1. С другой же стороны мы имеем совершенно неудобное управление на клавиатуре без возможности изменения, что напрочь отбивает желание дальше испытывать себя, потому что процентов 90% из смертей, которые я получил, были из-за управления. Поэтому -1. 

В итоге мы имеем 0, который, скорее всего, никак не изменится, потому что игра 2015 года и вряд-ли на неё пилят обновления.

review:
Vamo lá, O jogo é uma das minhas recomendações pessoais pra qualquer amante de jogos indies e de jogos em pixel art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383792242', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1681849632}
review:
The game forces you to play by the rules of the bosses with only like 2 of the few having obvious tricks around their fight, unlike games like dark souls where you decide what to do and when to do it. This game doesn't care about creating a strategy, it just hopes that you find out the only strategy there is to beat the boss and do it.

There is little to no room for error and the boss runs are just dumb, they litterally have no reason to exist and the "puzzles" are a waste of time. The designs of most bosses were also just lame or mid. They also either die within a minute of trying or you spend over 10 minutes to beat one. The difficulty is very wonky and all around a mess.

The game overall has nice graphics though and of whatever sound there was, it was good. I wouldn't even spend 5 bucks to buy this game, there is so much better elsewhere. You can get so many better games for 15 bucks or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356671084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1681702061}
review:
Ух, твою мать. Эта игра прошлась по ранам, еще оставленным SuperMeatBoy. Тоже сложная до ужаса, первый же босс может отбить у вас все желание играть. Если че, в этом вся игра - чисто жесткие зарубы с боссами, слово souls в названии не просто так стоит. Каждый из титанов уникальный, со своими приколами которые придется заучивать и как то с ними бороться. Музыка хорошая, которая немного скрашивала мою бомбежку. Вроде 5:30 часов не так много относительно, да возможно. Но соль в том что на протяжении всех 5 часов меня e6Aли в рот, причем дышал я исключительно через нос. Остальное время тратилось на пробежку до босса, что порой раздражало и в целом для меня это единственный минус. Если вы достаточно усидчивый и крепки на нервы, то можете попробовать. Более сложные режимы оставлю профессионалам, я прошел даже секретного титана TRUTH , так что план минимум я выполнил, я остался доволен

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2963516321

author: {'steamid': '76561198433134063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1682341436}
review:
== GAMEPLAY ==
 Um dos pontos mais marcantes é sua mecânica, quem acertar o primeiro golpe vence (em chefes os locais que devem ser acertados são mais específicos), o conceito é 1 golpe 1 morte (para ambos os lados), ressalto que isso pode ser frustrante para jogadores casuais, tendo níveis de difículdade elevados.
 O jogo limita o jogador, dando a ele apenas 1 flecha que deve acertar o chefe para derrotá-lo, mas a sensação de progresso de personagem é deixada de lado já que o jogador passará o jogo todo com essa única flecha e nada mais para auxiliá-lo nas lutas (além de uma esquiva para defesa).
 Infelizmente todas as vezes que você morre precisará caminhar novamente até a "Sala do chefe" e como premissa básica do jogo o desafio 1 golpe 1 morte, o jogador tende a morrer diversas vezes antes de aprender os padrões dos oponente, então você precisará caminhar diversas vezes para retornar até a luta.

== AMBIENTE / HISTÓRIA ==
 A forma simples como somos apresentados àquele mundo causa uma sensação de estranheza, sem sabermos o porquê de estarmos ali. A solidão do nosso personagem se torna impecávelmente desconfortável, a todo o momento buscamos algo ou alguém (uma solução para nossa situação atual).
 Ao caminharmos pelas trilhas cobertas de grama e olharmos para as paredes talhadas já em ruínas, nossa imaginação deve florecer! Passamos por construções, floresta, vulcão e neve, mas nada de mapa para orientar o jogador.
 Mas nem tudo são flores. Por mais divertido que a exploração possa parecer, ela também é cansativa, pois não se tem nada mais para fazer nesse mundo além de caminhar em busca do seu próximo oponente, então, esqueça boas narrativas por aqui (mas claro, você pode usar a sua imaginação).

== DIFICULDADES ==
 Aqui nossos oponentes são todos "Chefes" grandes criaturas que devemos derrotar para prosseguir nosso caminho (podemos enfrentá-los em qualquer ordem). Suas aparências transmitem uma sensação de sabedoria, dá a impressão que já estão nesse lugar há muitas décadas ou talvez séculos, e que estão apenas existindo nesse lugar a espera de seus fins (Jogo altamente inspirado em Shadow of the Colossus).
Seus desenhos também são muito bonitos, cada chefe é de uma aparência única e com suas diversidades da natureza, andando, nadando ou voando.
 
== CONCLUSÃO ==
 Caso você goste de desafios e tenha a disposição de enfrentar os oponentes diversas vezes para que possa sentir o gosto da vitória ao final de cada luta, esse jogo cumpre esse papel, mas nada de recompensas dentro do jogo. Caso você esteja procurando boas narrativas, puzzles, ou qualquer coisa que desvie da repetição de combates, de fato esse jogo não serve para você.

Prós:
Mecânicas faceis do personagem
Variedades de chefes
Variedade de mecânicas dos chefes
Desafiador para quem está começando
Cenários ok

Contras:
Ressucitar um POUCO longe dos chefes
Nada de narrativas
Nada de recompensas para o personagem

author: {'steamid': '76561197989062725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1681584480}
review:
Really fun boss rush game! All in all pretty short, took me under 3 hours to beat all bosses and get the true ending, so keep that in mind when considering purchasing this game. There are a ton more achievements I can unlock for taking down bosses in special ways or playing Hard/Iron mode, but I've had this game for a long time and I'm satisfied just getting the True ending.

Super simple mechanics: you have one button that dodges (or runs if you hold it) and the other button shoots a single arrow and calls the arrow back to you when you hold the button. You die in one hit, the bosses are punishing but ALSO die in one hit, so once you learn their patterns and finally make that blow, it is incredibly satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025282636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1681515852}
review:
This game was an exercise in frustration. I really liked the concept of one-hit kills against bosses, and I absolutely loved the atmosphere—the moody soundtrack and desolate pixel world were really working for me—but I couldn't bring myself to enjoy it.

The fights didn't seem well-matched to the character speed or abilities, and in some cases the mechanics were just wonky: at one point I beat a boss entirely by fluke. Exploring the (very small) world was fun, but what was NOT fun was walking back to each boss a dozen or more times rather than being able to just start the fight again. Some of the boss-puzzle solutions were pretty obtuse as well, and by the end I was just looking forward to finishing so I could write this review and put the game behind me.

Don't get me started on the final boss either, which was a real disappointment and seemed to have more to do with luck than anything. Finishing everything unlocked some new aspects of game lore for me, and that's usually what I'm looking for in my games, but I won't ever see it because the idea of playing this again is too much.

The game is mercifully short—I took about five hours, but most folks take less than that—but in no way worth the price tag at any less than a 75% discount, even if you enjoy this sort of thing. Go for this if you want a punishing challenge for an afternoon and no longer than that, but otherwise there are much better options out there for the mix of moody atmosphere and frantic combat.

This would be a good experience if not for all the parts that make it a game. 4/10.

review:
Boss rush style game.  You need to work out each bosses attack patterns and fire your 1 arrow at its weak spot, which can be tricky to find.  You die in 1 hit as well.   It's very satisfying when you work out what you need to do and make that shot.

Very short.  Grab it when its on sale for $2.

It's surprisingly fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315237893', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1673220310}
review:
[i]Originally posted on [url=http://www.dragon-quill.net/titan-souls/]Dragon Quill.[/url] Comments are enabled there.[/i]

This is sort of like a bite-sized 2D version of Shadow of the Colossus. (Despite what the name may lead you to think, it doesn’t actually have much similarity to Dark Souls.) You play as a tiny human fighting massive monsters, with some environmental storytelling hinting at surrounding context.

Here’s the most notable about this game: You only have one hit, but [i]so do the bosses[/i]. One hit to their weak point and that’s it, you’re done. This has blown my mind in regards to how I think about game design and game challenges, and I’m going to vomit those thoughts at you now.

Caveat: there are a few twists on this rule, like some bosses that require additional hits to expose their weak points, but all the fights can be finished very quickly if you know what you’re doing. I actually managed to get an achievement for killing a boss in under 10 seconds without even trying for it! This stuck out to me because most video game boss fights, even the more puzzle-y ones, are protracted slugfests that require you to strike the boss’ weak point many times.

Having that stripped away made me wonder… why? What does it add, actually? Once you’ve figured out how to hit the boss once, then unless the fight meaningfully changes afterwards, you’ve basically already won. The rest is just padding. (And I must say, it also does a lot more to respect the player’s time — if you get splatted midway, you haven’t actually lost any progress, as opposed to if the boss had a massive healthbar.) I suppose you could argue you have to do it multiple times to prove it’s not a fluke, but I find that a pretty weak argument. It was actually exciting to win several titan battles through lucky shots I just kinda hoped and prayed for.

Moreover, the game proves that doing this doesn’t require sacrificing challenge. The boss fights are all incredibly engaging, and extremely difficult despite how quickly you can win them. Despite usually having an obvious weak point, the bosses are actually very good at protecting them — you have extremely small windows to hit them, and their vulnerable states feel like realistic tactical slip-ups rather than a video game holding your hand. For example: One of the early bosses is one of those statues with detached fists that fly around to smash you, typical video game boss design. It has a huge glowing weak spot on its chest… but it actually uses those giant stone fists to cover its weak spot, so you can’t just take free potshots. The only way to beat it is to trick it into attacking you with both fists at once, then attack it in the split-second before it can retract its fist to cover itself again. That’s exactly the kind of genuine, split-second mistake people make in real battles, and I felt like a real tactical genius when I actually pulled it off. If that were a Zelda boss, it would leave both its fists idle for several seconds to give you a nice leisurely window to shoot it (if it bothered to do the guarding trick at all), but you’d have to shoot it like ten times. This equitable health model makes every battle genuinely tense, because the slightest mistake can mean sudden death for either side. It is, I think, the kind of tone Sekiro was trying to shoot for.

Of course, by trimming all the fat the game does end up very lean — I beat every boss, including the secret bonus boss, in under 4 hours. But those were a really great 4 hours, and the game has perhaps the highest satisfaction-to-playtime ratio I’ve experienced. This is a game that every action game designer should study, and ask themselves if they really need to include all that padding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276201596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1681126591}
review:
Oh look, a 'controller recommended'! that's unusual, I'm not familiar with controllers though so keyboard and mouse should be fine right?
Alright, I sort of get it, not like I have controllers but I assume the controls are the same, aiming requires you to try moving in a direction while in aiming mode, and a mouse can't do that without having a massive advantage over controllers, but seriously, limiting movement and more importantly aiming to 8 directions when the weak point you're aiming for can move around freely should not be the alternative to controllers.

That aside, the boss fights feels amazing! Fighting against massive titans, running around finding it's weak point and shooting it is really exciting! unfortunately, there's a lot of downtime, death does a 5s fade to/from black, sets you back anywhere from 5-12s away from the arena, the path there feels awkward sometimes, climbing and going up the stairs is painfully slow compared to rolling on a flat plane. all for a 10s attempt. One of the most enjoying fights were the very first slime boss which is the only boss that requires you to shoot multiple times and the most unpredictable boss, wish there was more like it.

As for difficulty, the normal mode is perfect in my opinion, it takes roughly 5-10 tries to get your strategies down, and I have that much patience, I do hate a few of the bosses, though that will be spared on the very last paragraph. I will share my general feelings on those bosses here though : They don't feel hard, just annoying.

Genuinely, it is a nice experience, if its already in your library you should definitely try. as I got it when it was free I can't say much about the price. But I still want to vent. The next chunk of text are spoilers of mid to final bosses

[spoiler] One of the biggest offender of the first complain are the knight boss, not only do you need to shoot a fast moving weak point, you also need to hope that the actual knight is in one of 8 directions when the arrow is hittable, the fight itself isn't even hard to survive. The soul boss shared the same problem, with a smaller and a more confusing weak point. Speaking of weak point, the ring boss also have that issue, as it was never established that spinning very fast makes it invulnerable, and the window of it not spinning was so small that I overlooked that it's a different vulnerable state. The new game+'s hard mode made this problem a lot worse, also making more bosses feels annoying. the only constant is the first slime boss feeling really good to fight and beat. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198096460277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1681094861}
review:
话说在前头，原价买肯定是不值的，初始难度初见大概4小时通关，卡关卡得厉害可能5.6个小时吧，打完之后很多人也不会去继续受苦其他难度，所以等于这游戏就是4-6小时左右的游戏时长，等史低入比较合理。
本作算是相当经典且有风格的甜品级硬核独游了，美术音乐等方面做得还是相当不错的，玩法更是有特色，原则上boss和玩家都是一条命，一击必杀，而玩家的整个游戏流程就是到处逛啊逛找boss，一边死一边摸清楚boss的弱点，规划打法，最后一击解决boss。
不要担心没有中文，整个游戏0对白，文本也就寥寥数行字，说实话汉不汉化没什么所谓。
因为作者有致敬旺达与巨像的缘故，所以本作会有些特征神似旺达与巨像。
比如全程无对白但有他自己的剧情表达。
比如孤身一人对抗的巨大BOSS。
比如只有BOSS战。
比如战斗中重点在于攻击BOSS的弱点。
游戏质量是在线的，但既然已经是硬核独游了，所以游戏的受众是面向真正的游戏爱好者的，初始难度也比较硬核，游戏素养不够的普通人或者蝗虫玩家既有受大苦的风险，也有对不上电波的风险，还有没有手柄导致操作僵硬进而体验糟糕的风险。
所以建议考虑清楚再入，要玩的话最好有个手柄，键鼠的游戏体验会低一些。
值得一提的是游戏里真正的终极boss需要前置条件解锁，即攻克隐藏boss。如果玩到最后发现职员表跳完了还在游戏里，面前大门跟堵墙一样，回头继续逛地图找剩下的隐藏boss吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198440407237', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1680822426}
review: The most painfully boring and terribly designed game I've ever played ever. This game is not just boring, it's also extremely frustrating and drains your life force with every minute that you play. I got zero enjoyement from this. The game expects you to fight titans (bosses). In order to beat a boss you need to find his weak point,  if you hit the weak point the boss dies, if the boss hits you then you die. One hit is all that's needed, I like the concept HOWEVER. That weak spot has a really scuffed hitbox you need a near perfect shot to hit it. Which is really frustrating especially when the game forces you to play with a controller because yes this game doesn't have proper keyboard and mouse controls. But that's assuming that you know how to kill the boss, most of the gameplay consists of you being confused and not knowing what to do and the scuffed hitboxes are just the cherry on the top. You will try different ways to kill the boss but you have no way of knowing which way is the correct one because once you try and fail something you will always doubt the game, "was it just the wrong way to fight this boss or did I just miss because of the hitbox ?". Not knowing what to do + Not being able to execute what you want to do because of the hitbox / controls problem absolutely ruins the game. There is also another element of gamelay that makes playing this extremely frustrating and it's the stupid checkpoints. Each time you die you return to the checkpoint in the center of the area. So 1/3 of your time playing this game will be just you running back to the boss that killed you. And just so you know the respawning animation is slow. The game punishes your death with boring walks. I forced myself to reach the final boss (the secret one) and I dropped the game. My mental health has deteriorated and I feel violated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198888752936', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1680823290}
review:
Me encanto el juego, su trabajo artístico, su música (que es increíble) y las mecánicas distintas para matar cada boss. Juego simple y ´´corto´´ a no ser que busques los logros que no son para nada fáciles. Empiezas con una flecha la cual puedes atraer a ti y la habilidad de rodar, con eso iras descubriendo zonas con distintos jefes con un punto débil pero no te lo darán fácil, activar botones, traerlos a lugares específicos y tener un timing de locos. En cuanto a lore no es que haya mucho mas que unos murales, un único jefe que te habla y el jefe final, de ahí conclusiones tuyas. 
En conclusión, lo recomiendo comprarlo si esta en oferta ya que su precio es muy elevado para el tiempo de gameplay.
Titan souls es definitivamente un juego, que si te gustan los retos y los boss rush, al 100% deberías jugar, ya que este es todo un referente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100289647', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1680646751}
review:
A ideia do jogo é interessante, o estilo de arte me atrai, mas contém diversos pontos que acabaram deixando a minha experiência negativa (derrotei 13 chefes no momento):

1- Boss-Fights majoritariamente 1hit-kill, para ambos os lados. Você toma um hit = você morre; você acerta um hit = você mata. Isso deixa muito difícil de aprender a batalha e saber se o que está fazendo está certo ou errado. A ideia de 1hit-kill deixa que muitas lutas tenham uma única mecânica, deixando elas uni-dimensionais, além de deixar a experiência frustrante (leva 1 hit = morre) e nada recompensadora. Todo Boss que matava eu não me sentia recompensado por esse mesmo motivo: se eu acertava, eu matava; isso faz com que tu não sinta que 'avance' em uma batalha por deixar o Boss com menos vida em uma tentativa do que outra. Ou você ganha, ou perde; não tem meio termo.

2- Em conjunto com a frustração de perder uma luta, a viagem do Checkpoint até a luta e o fade-out quando perde, faz com que você passe a maior parte do tempo caminhando do que lutando em si.

3- Ainda falando de caminhada. O jogo NÃO POSSUI mapa nem nenhuma forma de saber onde você está, o que matou e/ou o que falta matar ou para onde ir (pelo menos até onde eu joguei não achei nada disso). Passava um bom tempo passeando pelo mapa tentando encontrar onde deveria ir ou se estava seguindo o caminho certo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307219309', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1679800343}
review: 精品小游戏，免费领的，质量过关，说明了什么是麻雀虽小，五脏俱全。游戏画面是像素风，音乐轻松惬意，你要做的目标很简单，击败大概二十来种BOSS就能过关，中途甚至没有杂鱼小怪，也没有阻碍的机关陷阱，有的就是一个闪光的存档点，几扇通向BOSS的大门。游戏玩法也非常好理解易上手，没有错综复杂的道具没有千奇百怪的升级，有的就是利用手中只有一根弓箭的弓，通过射箭收箭，加上一个翻滚键和长按翻滚后聊胜于无的奔跑，击中攻击手段和行动模式都比较单一的各种BOSS的弱点，这也引出泰坦之魂的特色，就是你和BOSS都是一条命，谁先命中谁就赢，就是这么简单，有种游戏纯朴的快乐。总体难度适中，最开头的四个BOSS大概就花了半小时，大概几分钟一个，只有岩浆史莱姆一开始不了解机制略微受苦，最终的眼睛虽然有三个阶段但是摸清后也是很好过的，游戏内好像显示2-3个小时左右过关，其中更多时间是用来跑图，只有BOSS导致地图大又空，又要自己去找，森林的鬼打墙刚进去确实摸不着头脑，存档点有时候离BOSS稍远了一点，加上人物跑得慢所以很多时间都在路上。最后没有中文，不过也没有影响，话说这游戏真的有剧情吗，一趟下来除了教程就一个隐藏不用对战的BOSS有两句话。

author: {'steamid': '76561198833076753', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1680452784}
review:
O jogo é curto (com o cérebro desligado eu levei 3h pra zerar) e num geral, bom

Todos os bosses são puzzles, tem um ponto fraco que tu tem que acertar pra derrotar e a parte difícil é resolver esse "puzzle" de como acertar. Ainda não derrotei todos os bosses (deixei alguns pra trás pq o jogo não dá uma direção, então pensei que teria q voltar e derrotar eles posteriormente, é intuitivo mas não 100%) mas generalizando, os bosses são bons com algumas exceções, como o penúltimo onde a dificuldade se dá majoritariamente na hitbox dele sendo horrível tanto pros lasers quanto pras mãos. Num geral a dificuldade do jogo vem de vc tomar hitkill pra literalmente tudo (assim como muitos bosses) e eles terem mais recursos que você, além da janela de ataque ser pequena e você ter que carregar a flecha pra atirar. É sobre timing.
Outro ponto negativo que quero ressaltar é a locomoção e respawn, a parte mais difícil do jogo é a tortura de ter q andar alguns caminhos pra certos bosses, uma escolha meio esquisita de design que parece se inspirar em Souls, mas Souls mesmo no seu último lançamento (Elden Ring) tenta corrigir isso e diminuir a corrida por gauntlets e caminhos tortuosos. As rolagens não são Iframes e isso pode encher o saco em algumas horas, mas talvez comprometesse a dificuldade do jogo.

o ponto positivo é tudo que eu não critiquei aqui: os gráficos e trilha sonora são simples e impecáveis, a dificuldade do jogo é recompensadora e num geral, não é tão desbalanceado, parece um teste de battle iq que se torna divertido conforme tu pega o jeito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198857614373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1680410350}
review:
不知道为什么会有类魂标签，是不是有点难度的游戏在steam上都有这个标签XD
与魂相比，这游戏更像是塞尔达——我是指三角力量、缩小帽、四支剑这种2D/2.5D塞尔达。某些BOSS和设计甚至可以说像素级复刻。
节奏更快、容错更低带来了比塞尔达更高的难度。
对于我这种原教旨（划掉）塞尔达粉丝来说，其实还不错。于个人而言，美中不足的就是战斗方式的匮乏，如果有更多武器、道具可以选择或许会更有趣（那不就是塞尔达了嘛！）

review:
[h1] 본격 승부욕 자극 게임 [/h1]

조작법과 보스의 패턴은 단순하다
하지만 단순하지 않은 손을 가지고 있다면 쉽지 않을 것

중간중간 퍼즐 아닌 퍼즐형식으로 미로나 히든 찾는게 재밌었다
그냥 선물 받은김에 한 두판만 해볼까 하다가
앉은자리에서 기본모드 클리어 갈겨버렸음

아.. 한판만 더 아 씨x 진짜 한판만 더

하다가 끝까지 깨버리는 경험을 할 수 있다
하다보면 패턴이 눈에 보이고 손에 익어서 못 깰 게임은 아닌듯하다
멘탈이 많이 흔들리긴 함 (굴렀잖아, 쐈잖아, 이게 안 맞아? 등등...)

도전과제의 난이도가 상당히 괴랄하지만 꽤나 재밌어서 도전과제 러시 해볼 의향 있음

author: {'steamid': '76561199123197327', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1679877798}
review: Lindo, lindo, lindíssimo. Nossa que jogo gostoso, sério, eu achei a arte e movimentação desse jogo estupenda. Como você provavelmente já sabe, o jogo não é fácil, diversas vezes você vai ficar preso em uma parte, porém você raramente vai ficar preso por mais de 15 a 20 minutos na mesma parte. Apesar da morte ser na maioria das vezes inevitável, o jogo rapidamente te coloca de pé de novo, evitando a frustração que esse tipo de jogo geralmente propaga. O jogo tem uma duração bem baixa, justificando seu baixo preço, contudo, seu tamanho não é algo ruim, já que evita de te deixar cansado do jogo e enjoar dele, sinceramente, o tamanho ta ótimo, principalmente quando você percebe que foi feito por uma equipe de 3 pessoas. Resumidamente: Arte e trilha sonora linda, gameplay rápida com frustração no mínimo possível, e uma história até que interessante. Definitivamente recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050301254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1679866716}
review:
A really great commitment to a really bad idea.

All bosses kill you in one hit, but you also kill all bosses in one hit, so the entire point of the game is trying to find the opening or figure out the gimmick to hit the bosses weak point. Which sounds bad on paper already, but made worse that there is basically 0 content in this game except bosses. When finding an opening one time is enough to beat a boss, no boss is ever satisfying. There's never a moment where I'm low on hp, heart racing, almost to killing a boss I've been stuck on for an hour, because I'm always at one HP, and so is the boss. This means that the majority of play time you will be 
1. finding a boss in the world (which feels unjustifiably large for how little is actually in it
2. walking to the boss room from a checkpoint
3. trying to set up the opening against the boss
4. either missing and repeating steps 2 and 3, or landing the hit and repeating from step 1.

That's it. That's the whole game. Having a large number of bosses cannot act as a replacement for having good bosses, and you can't have good bosses when they all feel the same because they all die in one hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205727276', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1679825849}
review: 非常纯粹的游戏。该游戏的设计堪称大道至简，没有复杂的战斗系统，没有乱七八糟的主线支线剧情，甚至连小怪都没有（是的，这游戏只有boss战）。玩这款游戏时，我的正反馈来源只有一个：击败boss，负反馈也只有一个：被boss击败。在我和boss都能被对方秒杀的情况下，无论是正反馈和负反馈都来的如此快速而直接。随着击败的boss数越来越多，我能明显感受到自己面对boss时的勇气和智慧在不断增加，这真的很“soul”！

author: {'steamid': '76561198440314166', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1711236002}
review: Eu não faço a minima ideia o por que de eu não ter analisado esse jogo antes voltei a jogar recentemente pra tentar platinar e lembrei disso, enfim vamo la, Titan Souls é um jogo com uma dificuldade bem alta e desafiadora, e isso é um dos seus pontos mais fortes, se vc tiver determinação pra ficar batalhando contra um chefe só por mais de 30 minutos a satisfação de vitoria e de ter conseguido derrota-lo depois de tanto tempo tentando é INCRIVEL, ja fiquei mais de 1 hora em um só chefe do jogo e no momento que vc o derrota é uma sensação incrivel de ter conseguido.Sem falar que todos os chefes desse jogo são incriveis, um jeito inovador de vence-los a cada chefe e os design dos chefes todos são incriveis desde um chefe na agua que vc luta em cima de icebergs até um chefe dentro de uma caixa branca (bem feito demais inclusive) juntamente da trilha sonora que é surpreendente e incrivel, todos os chefes tem uma musica incrivel que combina com o chefe e sem falar das trilhas sonoras do proprio mapa sem estar em luta com algum dos chefes, uma trilha sonora incrivel, enfim 10/10 vale a pena demais Obra Prima

review: Os chefes são bem difíceis, o mundo cativante, o conceito bem diferente, tudo muito bem executado. Em suma um ótimo jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199447055336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1694641253}
review: difícil para um caralho, de longe esse foi o jogo mais difícil que eu já joguei, antes dele só o everhood por enquanto. passei raiva por morrer várias vezes em vários bosses diferentes, mas ainda sim me viciou e me prendeu de uma forma que eu não pude mais parar de jogar.O jogo é todo em 2D mas com alguns pequenos elementos em 3D (alguns bosses). Os cenários são todos em pixel art mas da para sentir que os desenvolvedores colocaram atenção e carinho em cada detalhe.As músicas são uma coisa incrível, dão uma ambientação única para o jogo, todavia, mal pude aproveita-las pelo fato de que na maior parte do tempo eu estava tentando prestar atenção nos ataques dos bosses para poder decorar ksks, mas ainda sim, sempre que eu parava para escuta-las sempre era uma coisa linda.Sim, o preço é relativamente caro para um jogo com uma duração não muito longa, mas acho que pode se dizer que ele vale o preço que eles pedem, no entanto, recomendo que espere por uma promoção, comprei a versão especial dele por uns 6 reais na promoção.Em geral, jogo incrível. Ainda não platinei, por isso ainda tem algumas coisas para fazer, mas se for levar em consideração só o jogo base, poderia durar mais (isso é só um talvez, as vezes os devs queriam que jogo fosse assim mesmo). Se quiser jogar, vale muito a pena pegar ele numa promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561199175290775', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1679694438}
review:
Buen primer juego de los creadores de Deaths Door, no puedo decir que no me divertí y me la pasé bien derrotando jefes, pero por supuesto trae algunos problemas que estropean un poco la experiencia
.1.-Los checkpoints deberían estar justo en la batalla con el jefe, no tiene sentido que se trate de un boss rush y cuando te maten tengas que volver a recorrer cierto camino para volver a pelear.
2.-POR QUÉ WEA NO TIENE MENÚ DE PAUSA, no tiene sentido tampoco, ni que fuera algún juego online qpedo
3.-La música de David Fenn es increíble, pero una vez que pierdes con el jefe se termina, lo cual es malardo teniendo en cuenta que no se logra apreciar del todo si es que pierdes o acabar con el jefe rápidamente, lo cual hace que este punto esté ligado con el primero y el de abajo también
4.-Las pantallas de carga son algo largas para el juego que es, entendería si fuera un AAA pero es un juego indie sobre matar bosses, lo cual termina pausando el ritmo de juego
5.-El mundo en general es algo largo para recorrer cuando está totalmente vacío salvo que algun que otro secreto o ruta.
6.-Los controles están bien pero a veces están algo incómodos, agradecería si hubiera algún tipo de auto apuntado o asistencia con el ratón, ya que muchas veces estoy a punto de ganarle a un jefe pero el personaje no puede apuntar a ese lugar, es algo que saca de quicio, no se como explicarloY por último pero no menos importante, si bien es divertido pelear con tantos jefes, al final la mecánica es casi siempre la misma, esperar a que hagan cierto movimiento y dispararle la flecha, sé que por el estilo de juego no se puede permitir mucha variedad pero eso hace que se vuelvan predecibles los jefes, el jefe final igual es decepcionante y al final es más cuestión de suerte y de timing que hace que las batallas terminen de forma abrupta y duren poco, y la habilidad termina pasando a un segundo plano.

author: {'steamid': '76561199119583335', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1680264871}
review: Bom game, bem polido e satisfatório de se jogar, excelentes bosses e designs (alguns nem tanto, tem um certo cavaleiro com nível de dificuldade MUITO acima dos demais) além de uma excelente trilha sonora. Mesmo com tudo isso dito, infelizmente não posso recomendar totalmente. O jogo não conta com mapeamento dos controles o que pra mim seria ideal pra um jogo como esse (porém ganha pontos por ter suporte pra ultrawide). Além disso, e mais importante ponto negativo, é muito ruim o fato de morrer fácil, ter transições demoradas e voltar longe dos bosses, sinto que isso é punitivo demais e uma péssima decisão de design e é impossível eu recomendar o game com esses pontos ditos, uma pena.

review: It's not a long game, but it's a very rewarding game. You can probably beat it in one sitting. It's a game about fighting bosses and everyone has 1hp, including you. Once you beat the game, there's a harder new game+ mode, as well as achievements for every boss for doing certain things during the battle. It's a fun time and is a game I come back to play once every year or two, so it has at least a little bit of replay-ability.

author: {'steamid': '76561199115369591', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1692542058}
review: Titan Souls é bom e desafiador. A ambientação desse jogo é muito boa, o jogador explora esse local "abandonado" que só habitam os titãs, lembrando demais Shadow of the Colossus. Mesmo o foco do jogo sendo o combate e as lutas contra os diversos chefes, a exploração e o cenário são misteriosos e te fazem querer entender mais desse mundo. Se for jogar, recomendo que jogue com um controle, que torna a gameplay muito mais fluída e consequentemente fácil, já que esse jogo foi feito pensando no uso do analógico para mirar seus ataques. Recomendo bastante

author: {'steamid': '76561199078832667', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1679195874}
review:
Este juego no es del todo malo pero tiene sus defectos que me dan la razón para darle una mala reseña.

En base a lo que he jugado hasta ahora de este juego puedo decir que tiene un dificultad artificial, convirtiendo jefes que podrían ser efímeros pero frenética la experiencia de enfrentarte a ellos porque quien da el primer golpe gana en tan solo patrones interminables con ataques pasivos y principales injustos hasta casi imposibles aun sabiendo que tu única arma es una flecha mágica que cuando la usas o la vas a recoger o la "llamas" para que vuelva a ti, ademas de contar con sistema de rodar muy trillado aparte de ni si quiera darnos alguna novedad o algo para poder variar un poco el estilo de combate sintiéndose repetitivo, monótono y aburrido al corto tiempo haciendo que no pueda disfrutar este juego como debería sin ignorar la muy vaga por no decir nula personalización de controles y muy pobre menú de opciones.

Los puntos a favor que tengo para destacar de este juego su banda sonora, encaja perfectamente en el mundo y espacio que se esta experimentado acompañado de un diseño minimalista y simple pero que cumple con un nivel de bastante bueno para ser un juego indie salido el 2015 pero aun y con todo esto no termina de ser de mi agrado este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561199445354115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1679173412}
review: This game doesn't respect your time. I got through the first gate at minute 40 going in blind. I went back and used a stop watch to see how much of my playtime was spent loading and back tracking. It came out 15 minutes out of a 40 minute play through. Once you get passed the first gate you have to travel WAY farther to reach the boss. I can't fathom how much time would be spent wasted walking in this game. Its not like traveling with the horse in shadow of the colossus or exploring an interesting castle like ico. Its walking around a boring hub world to get smashed in a couple seconds repeat. They wanted to pad out the games length by making you waste a bunch of time walking to the encounter. I have no doubt i could clear this game in under an hour if i could respawn immediately after dying. If you value your time i would avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016072630', 'num_games_owned': 1746, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1679159734}
review: I was looking forward for this game for a long time but I was very disappointed. There are no upgrades, just a few bosses and that's it. After beating the game you have some hard modes available. My biggest problem was not very fluent movement, kind of stiff. You cannot bind the keys, there are arrows and 2 keys you need and you can't bind it for some reason. I prefer keyboard and at the last boss I found out that keyboard has limited aiming for just 8 directions and you can't use the mouse. So even though I don't like aiming with the joystick I had to use it at least for the final boss. There should be also a possibility to restart the fights right away instead of having to run from a checkpoint. Overall the game isn't that bad, it is just shame that those few details are ruining the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268082663', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1678992947}
review: I love challenging games, but I couldn't enjoy Titan Souls. The checkpoint system was extremely annoying. I felt like I did more walking back to bosses than actually fighting. With how unforgiving the bosses are, one hit and you're dead, you'd hope that the checkpoints would put you right back outside the boss. And I wish defeating the bosses felt exciting and rewarding, but the controls felt clunky and slow, and I got hardly any satisfaction from beating the bosses. I dropped this game more than halfway through, but perhaps one day I'll find the time to finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075194061', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1628467481}
review: You one shot bosses, bosses one shot you. Outside of the boss fights, you are mostly just exploring atmospheric landscapes and trying to piece together a very obtuse story, but in them you get to enjoy some great animation, generally pretty good fights and cool theming. I overall enjoy the game, but can only recommend it to people who love 2d games and boss fight focused games like Furi, Dark Souls and megaman simultaniously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118339047', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1678999948}
review: Rediscovered this game after realizing it was made by the same dev team behind Death's Door. Truly a hidden gem that has been lost to time. Quick fun challenge that has the mission statement: What if you AND the monster only take one hit to kill. No one talks about this game which is a real shame. This title has some of the most unique battles and with simple but difficult to master mechanics. It's a cool af no hit boss fighting simulator, with a well designed world (purely in visuals, I'm sure there's a cool story here, but not my focus with this one) and beautiful music. And be warned. True challenge awaits you. Whether you prevail with skill, perseverance, or just blind luck. All feel great to achieve.P.S.  (get on sale it goes for like 2 bucks usually)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057728888', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1678761744}
review:
Interesting boss fights marred by uninteresting checkpoints.

I enjoy what this game does visually and mechanically as a soulslike game, but it also gets hindered by its strange map design.

As a boss rush game, the whole concept of one-touch one-kill is very exciting, you get only one chance to survive the fight, but most bosses also only take one good well-aimed arrow to be defeated. 

As such, this game should be enforcing that gameplay loop, but instead, the distance you have between checkpoints and boss fights very quickly cool down that short burst of excitement too much too often. 

In comparison to something like DS or elden ring or even Monster Hunter, the space between fainting and engaging the boss can often be used by the player to stock up on resources and prepare for the next try. However, this game doesn't have any resources for the player to make use of, due to its simplicity.

What you end up with is just a frustrating checkpoint system that does nothing but annoy you as backtrack the same route to engage with the one fun part of the game. 

I don't hate this game, I just dislike how it really disengages me really quickly, by the nature of said checkpoints.

review:
Ótimo jogo, Pixel art linda, trilha sonora atmosférica ótima, e todos os bosses são desafiantes e divertidos de lutar contra. Cada área tem uma temática e uma identidade e todas são bem legais de explorar. E por mais que os bosses sejam difíceis e desafiadores de se vencer, o caminho que você faz até chegar até eles é tranquilo e calmo que te deixa pensar e aproveitar toda a beleza do jogo.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198312690055', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1678061422}
review:
Un jeu créé lors d'une Game Jam, on voit que le thème a été respecté.
On n'a qu'une flèche, qu'un PV, il n'y a qu'un ennemi, qu'on tue en un coup.
Du coup ce jeu est une série de boss, avec une manière différente de tuer chacun, plus ou moins originale et plus ou moins exigeante.
La musique est très sympas mais les boucles de certaines sont trop courtes. Des boss ont même leur propre musique ! 
Jeu fini en 4h, je le conseille à tout le monde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081141395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1677961396}
review: Спасибо художнику за проделанную работу, и местному композитору, они старались. Остальные заднеприводные, которых мир в жизни не видывал. Сложности нет как таковой, тупо дрочево идеального тайминга в начале файта у большинства боссов. С хитбоксами беда страшенная, просто не чувствуется ни фигурка игрока ни атаки боссов. Также я застревал за все время что играю 5 раз, слава те Хоспаде, что не в ответственный момент, но что за чушь. Хит рег уязвимых мест некоторых боссов очень плохой, по 300 раз приходится долбиться в одни ворота (Например зубы у одного из боссов, попробуйте выбить ему все 5 зубов, офигеете). Даже самому лютому врагу не посоветую. Друзьям и подавно. Ребят не  делайте ошибки эта игра даже смешанных отзывов недостойна.

author: {'steamid': '76561198428695746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1653155374}
review:
[h1]Interesting but Alienating[/h1]
I was gifted this by a friend - And I adore the idea this game is centered around but good lord some aspects could've been handled so much better. I try to aim for 30 hours of playtime (or getting an ending if the amount of content doesn't permit 30 hours) before writing a review, but I really don't think I would've enjoyed going for that long.
Pros:
+ Conceptually, the combat is actually pretty solid! Armed with a bow, a single arrow, and telekinesis to aid in retrieving that arrow, you're tasked with working through a gauntlet of boss fights where you need to land one single shot on the boss' weakpoint to win a given fight. From what I've seen, the bosses all have some pretty unique patterns to them and the intervals of these patterns can be super fast, making the window of opportunity very narrow.
+ From what I remember, every boss seems to have its own track, that's a pretty rare occurrence from my experience! The graphics are pretty good too.
Cons:
- The exact window of opportunity that's presented by a boss isn't always hard to spot, but [i]executing[/i] the steps/motions needed can often be another story. The boss that brick walled me in this way was the [spoiler]Legendary Titan Slayer, who has an electrified arrow that you need to shoot, then retrieve your arrow and shoot at the Slayer himself - I [b]think[/b], I never successfully pulled it off. Might not sound that hard, but keep in mind the window of opportunity is REALLY NARROW.[/spoiler] 
- This game oh-so-desperately needs a quick-retry option. As is, the way respawning plays out is you get killed > screen slowly fades to black > screen slowly fades back in > you're now back at a central checkpoint for a given area, and you have to run back to the arena. I don't mind long respawn times usually, but here, the fact the fading and run-back will almost certainly take up at least 80% of your time making attempts at a boss is horribly imbalanced, that is a ton of dead air.
- My single biggest frustration with this game comes from a self-made rule I have started to call "scheme parity". The basic idea is that every input system that a game supports (keyboard, gamepad, or whatever other weird junk you can think of) should have no substantial advantage or disadvantage over the alternatives available. This game [i]horribly[/i] breaks that rule with its aiming controls. You hold a button down to change the movement controls into aiming controls, and release to fire/go back; on a gamepad, this works just fine as you use an analog stick to move, but on keyboard? You're stuck with the arrow keys. Keep in mind that's only 8 directions keyboard players are allotted, and those other in-between directions are often super important for beating a boss, meaning you're effectively crippled in this game if you so much as lack even a DualShock 3/Sixaxis controller, when they could've incorporated the mouse in some way that doesn't completely tip the scales in its favor. I have been on both sides of this cause the game didn't pick up on my 8bitDo controller when I first tried it, and it really pains me. [strike]This game is almost pay-to-win solely because of an oversight in the controls, how the fu[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198851336562', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1677857135}
review: Если у игры хорошая графика, хороший дизайн, хороший саунд, впрниципе неплохой геймплей, но управление их жопы, то игра гавно

author: {'steamid': '76561198068333148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1677269523}
review:
I have some problems with this game, starting with the fact that they don't allow you to modify the controls. Also, being a Boss Rush it is logical that you must follow the pattern, you die - learn - repeat, but this game makes it tedious in a horrible way, every time you die you are sent to a "Checkpoint", from which you must retrace the path, re-enter the dungeon, re-activate the Boss, I know at first it seems silly, but as the game scales in difficulty believe me it becomes very tedious, to the point that it ends up ruining the experience for you. The pixel art is not bad at all, it's simple, but it works, however, the game lacks story as such.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tengo algunos problemas con este juego, empezando por el hecho de que no te permiten modificar los controles. Además, al ser un Boss Rush es lógico que debes seguir el patrón, mueres - aprendes - repites, pero este juego lo hace tedioso de una manera horrible, cada que mueres te mandan a un “Punto de control”, desde el cual debes volver a recorrer el camino, volver a entrar a la mazmorra, volver a activar el Boss, sé que al principio parezca una tontería, pero conforme el juego escala en dificultad créeme que se vuelve muy tedioso, al punto que termina de arruinarte la experiencia. El pixel Art no está para nada mal, es simple, pero funciona, sin embargo, el juego carece de historia como tal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316142233', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1660939571}
review: Очень необычный боссфайтер. Написано соулслайк, но хочу прояснить что в этой игре нет ни прокачки ни мобов, только боссы и парочка твоих движений. Короче если вы дрочила соулса на супермега25истязании то это для вас. Боссы очень интересные, супер крутые механики, по началу абсолютно не понимаешь как их убить и когда вроде понял оказывается что ты лишь лешил его одного вида оружия. Боссов достаточно много и  с учётом того что убивать их не быстро, то игра себя абсолютно стоит. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198936354697', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1700948952}
review:
before you buy this game i think i should tell you that is requires a lot of patience and perseverance. The whole premise is that everything goes down in one hit including yourself ,most boss have a weak sot you have to hit in order to do this ( some bosses require additional hits to expose their weak spots ). This can lead lead to a lot of frustration as you would usually know what to do but are unable to do it for what ever reason that occurs.

A controller is highly recommend since the keyboard and mouse controls are awful for this game as they are not remap-able in game. the keyboard and mouse controls use the arrow keys, x and c if i remember correctly which is not they greatest since your now limited to 8 directions toy can shoot your bow ( considering that all the combat is done with your bow this is a massive downside as being able to quickly and accurately land an arrow makes or breaks some fights). with a controller on the other hand the game plays perfectly as you can use the second stick to aim you arrow making they fights a lot easier. 

One other issue i have found which can be very annoying is that the game is tied to your display scaling (on windows settings) which can be a problem for anyone using a display scale that is not 100% as the game doesn't properly scale correctly when its not at 100%. i found this out after upgrading my monitor just to find out that that the is zoomed in at 125% causing it be be unplayable for me. i can also get quite tedious to change the display scale in settings every time you want to play the game so i thought i should mention this in the review.

The world is stunning but empty. they is also no map in game so it can get very hard to navigate too.

The bosses are the reason i keep coming back to this game as they are very unique as they require skill, similar to dark souls where you create a mental game plan and execute it, as your execution is the single most important part of combat. dependent on your skill level this game can be completed in half a hour could take you 10s of hours to complete most fights take 3 minutes max to complete if you know what your doing.

Ignoring the problems i have faced this can me a incredible rewarding and fun game to play if you have to even play though it. i recommend waiting for a sale if you want to pick it up as this game isn't for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094489753', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1610916950}
review: Titan Souls é um jogo indie desafiador que oferece uma experiência única de batalha de chefes. Com gráficos minimalistas e uma jogabilidade baseada em um único golpe para matar cada chefe, o jogo testa a habilidade e a paciência dos jogadores. Embora possa ser frustrante, a sensação de superar cada batalha é extremamente gratificante. Se você gosta de jogos de batalha de chefes difíceis, Titan Souls é uma ótima escolha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800465298', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1676374186}
review:
“一命”对抗“一命”的游戏少之又少，因为玩家“一命”往往代表极低的容错与极高的难度，敌人“一命”则趋近割草般的过于简单。
而《泰坦之魂》却通过各种巨物boss给予了主角“一命”的理由，它们普遍的缓慢、长前后摇又缓解了难度；同时，boss们往往通体无敌、仅一处较短时间或巧妙角度暴露的弱点，又让主角将其击败并不会简单。
两种“一命”一经调和，加之该游戏仅箭矢射击收回、翻滚为核心的精简操作，就诞生了《泰坦之魂》独特的玩法节奏——玩家初见boss，不断试错熟悉boss招式，随之通过常识结合色彩、特效等发现boss弱点，最后技术与少许运气结合，将箭矢射入boss某块相对柔软的部分，达成击杀。
这样的体验我更愿称之为“动作解密”——在快速的行动与操作中进行观察解密。这既不同于传统解密静态沉思的特性，又区别于传统动作游戏通过或有或无的血条与数值来调控玩家与敌人之间的博弈，极其新颖、但同时也意味着《泰坦之魂》必定会极其小众。 除了体量是合乎独立游戏的普遍短小，《泰坦之魂》无论是音乐与美术呈现、还是场景与Boss设计等各方面，都是没有短板的。
4.4 / 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198257382152', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1696713593}
review:
Um jogo criado em 2015 que pode ser considerado atemporal, pelo menos eu considero.

Você tem uma flecha e um objetivo, e é melhor que cada inimigo comece a rezar, pois você não irar para, talvez por ganancia, talvez para testar a si mesmo, porem isso não importa.

Nesse jogo você terá sua determinação testada, você pode matar todos seus inimigos com apenas um golpe, mas isso vale para você também. Você passara por vários titãs, com cada um com seus designer único, e com movimentações únicas, você terá que decorar e aprender como vencer, talvez isso seja de primeira ou talvez demore 30m, vai de cada um. 

Vi algumas pessoas reclamando sobre o fato de não ser pratico certas coisas, como por exemplo entrar na sala do boss e essas coisas, e pra mim isso é preguiça ou você morreu muito e ta cansado, porem dai é algo da sua experiencia e não sinceramente algo ruim do jogo, pelo menos ao meu ver, eu joguei o jogo inteiro e não me incomodei em andar um pouco para chegar no boss, não acho uma reclamação tão ruim, porem não acho que isso é motivo para o jogo não ser considerado bom.

Bem, as musicas desse jogo são incríveis junto com alguns detalhes que você pode ver e tentar descobrir, ele tem um fator replay interessante para quem se interessa, no qual você descobre um pouco mais sobre os titãs e por ai vai.

 Eu gosto muito desse jogo e ele pra mim foi um marco por ser muito bom, eu RECOMENDO MUITO, ele é interessante bem feito, com musica, pixel arte até uma historinha caso queira.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042867551', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1676334370}
review:
Pretty fun short game. Get it on sale or in a bundle.

There are some difficult boss fights, but they can be killed very quickly if you figure out the mechanics. It seems like getting fast 1-cycle kills on bosses is the intended way to play it. The short dodge roll can feel insufficient in long fights with no i-frames versus the bosses' incredibly fast attacks. Finally hitting the boss after lining up their weak spot feels great, though.

Biggest gripes were:
- Aiming could have been better, at times the arrow seemed to fly slightly off from the direction held. 
- WAY too much screen shake with no way to tune it down or turn it off
- Your arrow can get stuck pretty easily behind any obstacle/enemy

review:
보스 원샷원킬! 너두? 나두!?

보스의 약점을 찾아내서 공략한다면 원킬이 가능한 보스 레이드 게임입니다. 오직 보스만 등장

활 쏘기, 화살 회수, 구르고 달리는 것이 다입니다.

[h1]장점[/h1]
1. 보스를 처치하는 재미, 원샷원킬!
2. 도전욕구

[h2]단점[/h2]
1. 쓸 때 없이 크기만 한 전체 맵, 그로 인해 걸리는 이동시간
2. 어딘가 불편한 조작과 행동
3. 보스 처치후 소울 획득시 반복되고 길기만 한 아무 의미 없는 연출
4. 게임 엔딩 한 번 보고 나면 이제는 반복이다.
5. 도전과제 중 노데스 클리어 ㅂㄷㅂㄷ

author: {'steamid': '76561198027845400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1675794684}
review:
Great but very short game. If you like me dont like running around looking for the bosses and want a more straightforward buss rush experience there is about 2 hours of content here. If you want to explore very thoroughly for every single boss to aim for a true boss clear or do any of the increased difficulty modes then this can last you a while.

Even if it was short to me it was also very sweet, the one hit kill mechanics are very fun to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153475643', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1675790346}
review:
short and cute, makes you a bit mad but you just can't stop playing, hahah. you don't need a controller to beat it all the way if you don't mind having the added difficulty of being able to shoot in only 8 directions (which isn't as bad as it sounds, you just need to think a bit more about positioning yourself and everything around you before shooting).

the bosses are really fun and well designed. if you know exactly what you're doing and get used to dodging you can beat them all super fast. figuring out weakpoints is as easy as trusting your instincts after seeing a single attack cycle or experimenting a little. the downtime after death before you get back to the boss is actually a good addition (there's a single titan you spawn right in front of and the lack of downtime actually wears you out faster!) as it let's you calm down and think of a strategy. and i love love love the lack of repetition in the fights! you never have to repeat the same action 3 times, both you and the bosses are one-shot. 

overall an amazing game for people looking for a challenge <3 if you found hyper light drifter and cuphead fun, this is a good addition to your library, albeit a bit more difficult!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050615144', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1564148564}
review:
Combat is quite good and feels nice difficulty wise and the one arrow mechanic puts an interesting spin on the combat however

walking back every time i die is soul crushingly boring and tedious. taking in the atmosphere and environment isn't so nice after you've done it several times.

I get that you want to punish dying, but in a boss rush game like this where a fight can end within seconds it's just not reasonable to expect the player to walk back every time, dying and not getting progress should be punishment enough.

If you don't have a pet peeve about games wasting your time you'll probably like this game
